accident.definition: An unexpected event with negative consequences occurring without the intention of the one suffering the consequences.

account.definition: A registry of pecuniary transactions; a written or printed statement of business dealings or debts and credits, and also of other things subjected to a reckoning or review.

ace.definition: A single point or spot on a playing card or die.

acorn.definition: The fruit of the oak, being an oval nut growing in a woody cup or cupule.

acre.definition: An English unit of land area (symbol: a. or ac.) originally denoting a day's plowing for a yoke of oxen, now standardized as 4,840 square yards or 4,046.86 square meters.

actor.definition: A person who performs, plays a part in a theatrical play or film.

advertisement.definition: A commercial solicitation designed to sell some commodity, service or similar.
advertisement.example: Companies try to sell their products using advertisements in form of placards, television spots and print publications.

advice.definition: An opinion offered in an effort to be helpful.
advice.example: She was offered various piece of advice on what to do with her new-found wealth.

affair.definition: (often in the plural) Something which is done or is to be done; business of any kind, commercial, professional, or public.

afraid.definition: (usually used predicatively, not attributively, be afraid) Impressed with fear or apprehension; in fear.

afternoon.definition: The part of the day from noon or lunchtime until sunset, evening, or suppertime or 6pm.

age.definition: The whole duration of a being, whether animal, plant, or other kind, being alive.

agent.definition: One who exerts power, or has the power to act

air.definition: The substance constituting earth's atmosphere, particularly:
air.example: I'm going outside to get some air.

aircraft.definition: A vehicle capable of atmospheric flight due to interaction with the air, such as buoyancy or lift

airplane.definition: A powered heavier-than-air aircraft with fixed wings.

airport.definition: An airfield (an area designated for the takeoff and landing of aircraft), including one or more runways and (for commercial airports) one or more passenger terminals.
airport.example: Because of this, and contrary to popular belief, British airports primarily act as giant wealth extractors, transporting our richest citizens out of the country as often as possible to take their money overseas. ― The Independent, Heathrow expansion to mainly benefit wealthy frequent fliers, research finds, 23 june 2018.

alarm.definition: A summons to arms, as on the approach of an enemy.

albatross.definition: Any of various large seabirds of the family Diomedeidae ranging widely in the Southern Ocean and the North Pacific and having a hooked beak and long narrow wings.

alcohol.definition: Any of a class of organic compounds (such as ethanol) containing a hydroxyl functional group (-OH).

alligator.definition: Either of two species of large amphibious reptile, Alligator mississippiensis or Alligator sinensis, in the genus Alligator within order Crocodilia, which have sharp teeth and very strong jaws and are native to the Americas and China, respectively.
alligator.example: All you could see of the alligator were its two eyes above the water, and suddenly it snatched up and caught the poor bird with its strong jaws full of sharp teeth.

ambulance.definition: An emergency vehicle designed for transporting seriously ill or injured people to a hospital.

analysis.definition: Decomposition into components in order to study (a complex thing, concept, theory etc.).

anchor.definition: A tool used to moor a vessel to the bottom of a sea or river to resist movement.

angel.definition: An incorporeal and sometimes divine messenger from a deity, or other divine entity, often depicted in art as a youthful winged figure in flowing robes.

anger.definition: A strong feeling of displeasure, hostility or antagonism towards someone or something, usually combined with an urge to harm.
anger.example: You need to control your anger.

angle.definition: A figure formed by two rays which start from a common point (a plane angle) or by three planes that intersect (a solid angle).
angle.example: the angle between lines A and B

ankle.definition: The skeletal joint which connects the foot with the leg; the uppermost portion of the foot and lowermost portion of the leg, which contain this skeletal joint.

ant.definition: Any of various insects in the family Formicidae in the order Hymenoptera, typically living in large colonies composed almost entirely of flightless females.

antlers.definition: A branching and bony structure on the head of deer, moose and elk, normally in pairs. They are grown and shed each year. (Compare with horn, which is generally not shed.)
antlers.example: While hiking in the woods, I found an antler from a deer.

anvil.definition: A heavy iron block used in the blacksmithing trade as a surface upon which metal can be struck and shaped.

anxiety.definition: An unpleasant state of mental uneasiness, nervousness, apprehension and obsession or concern about some uncertain event.

apartment.definition: A complete domicile occupying only part of a building, especially one for rent; a flat.

applause.definition: The act of applauding; approbation and praise publicly expressed by the clapping of hands, stamping or tapping of the feet, acclamation, huzzas, or other means; marked commendation.

apple.definition: A common, round fruit produced by the tree Malus domestica, cultivated in temperate climates.

appointment.definition: The act of appointing a person to hold an office or to have a position of trust

apron.definition: An article of clothing worn over the front of the torso and/or legs for protection from spills; also historically worn by Freemasons and as part of women's fashion.

architect.definition: A professional who designs buildings or other structures, or who prepares plans and superintends construction.
architect.example: Plato made the causes of things to be matter, ideas, and an efficient architect.

area.definition: A measure of the extent of a surface; it is measured in square units.

argument.definition: A fact or statement used to support a proposition; a reason.

aristocrat.definition: One of the aristocracy, nobility, or people of rank in a community; one of a ruling class; a noble (originally in Revolutionary France).

arm.definition: The portion of the upper human appendage, from the shoulder to the wrist and sometimes including the hand.
arm.example: She stood with her right arm extended and her palm forward to indicate “Stop!”

armada.definition: A fleet of warships, especially with reference to the Spanish Armada.

armadillo.definition: Any of the burrowing mammals covered with bony, jointed, protective plates, order Cingulata, found in the Americas, especially in South America.

armor.definition: A protective layer over a body, vehicle, or other object intended to deflect or diffuse damaging forces.

army.definition: A large, highly organized military force, concerned mainly with ground (rather than air or naval) operations.
army.example: The army was sent in to quell the uprising.

arrow.definition: A projectile consisting of a shaft, a point and a tail with stabilizing fins that is shot from a bow.

article.definition: A piece of nonfictional writing such as a story, report, opinion piece, or entry in a newspaper, magazine, journal, dictionary, encyclopedia, etc.

ash.definition: The solid remains of a fire.
ash.example: Ash from a fireplace can restore minerals to your garden's soil.

assistant.definition: Someone who is present; a bystander, a witness.

astronaut.definition: A member of the crew of a spaceship or other spacecraft that travels beyond Earth's atmosphere, or someone trained to serve that purpose.

atmosphere.definition: The gases surrounding the Earth or any astronomical body.

attic.definition: The space, often unfinished and with sloped walls, directly below the roof in the uppermost part of a house or other building, generally used for storage or habitation.
attic.example: We went up to the attic to look for the boxes containing our childhood keepsakes.

audience.definition: A group of people within hearing; specifically, a large gathering of people listening to or watching a performance, speech, etc.
audience.example: We joined the audience just as the lights went down.

aunt.definition: The sister or sister-in-law of one’s parent.

author.definition: The originator or creator of a work, especially of a literary composition.
author.example: Have you read any Corinthian authors?

avalanche.definition: A large mass or body of snow and ice sliding swiftly down a mountain side, or falling down a precipice.

avocado.definition: The large, usually yellowish-green or black, pulpy fruit of the avocado tree.

award.definition: A judgment, sentence, or final decision. Specifically: The decision of arbitrators in a case submitted.

axe.definition: A tool for felling trees or chopping wood etc. consisting of a heavy head flattened to a blade on one side, and a handle attached to it.

baby.definition: A very young human, particularly from birth to a couple of years old or until walking is fully mastered.

babysitter.definition: A person who cares for one or more babies or children for a short period of time in place of their legal guardians.
babysitter.example: My neighbor is sometimes a babysitter for other moms' children.

back.definition: The rear of the body, especially the part between the neck and the end of the spine and opposite the chest and belly.
back.example: Could you please scratch my back?

backbone.definition: The series of vertebrae, separated by disks, that encloses and protects the spinal cord, and runs down the middle of the back in vertebrate animals.

backfire.definition: A small, controlled fire set in the path of a larger uncontrolled fire, in order to limit the spread of the large fire by removing its fuel.

background.definition: One's social heritage, or previous life; what one did in the past.
background.example: The lawyer had a background in computer science.

backpack.definition: A knapsack, sometimes mounted on a light frame, but always supported by straps, worn on a person’s back for the purpose of carrying things, especially when hiking, or on a student's back when carrying books.

backspace.definition: The key on a typewriter that moves the head one position backwards.

bacon.definition: Cured meat from the sides, belly or back of a pig.

badminton.definition: A racquet sport played indoors on a court by two opposing players (singles) or two opposing pairs of players (doubles), in which a shuttlecock is volleyed over a net and the competitions are presided by an umpire in British English and a referee in American English.

bag.definition: A flexible container made of cloth, paper, plastic, etc.

baggage.example: Please put your baggage in the trunk.

baguette.definition: A narrow, relatively long rectangular shape.

bakery.definition: A shop in which bread (and often other baked goods such as cakes) is baked and/or sold.

balance.definition: A state in which opposing forces harmonise; equilibrium.

ball.definition: A solid or hollow sphere, or roughly spherical mass.
ball.example: a ball of spittle; a fecal ball

balloon.definition: An inflatable buoyant object, often (but not necessarily) round and flexible.

bamboo.definition: A grass of the Poaceae family, characterised by its woody, hollow, round, straight, jointed stem, all of which are in the Bambuseae tribe.

banana.definition: An elongated curved tropical fruit that grows in bunches and has a creamy flesh and a smooth skin.

band.definition: A strip of material used for strengthening or coupling.

bang.example: When he struck it with a hammer, there was a loud bang.

banjo.definition: A stringed musical instrument (chordophone), usually with a round body, a membrane-like soundboard and a fretted neck, played by plucking or strumming the strings.
banjo.example: I come from Alabama with my banjo on my knee...

bank.definition: An institution where one can place and borrow money and take care of financial affairs.

bar.definition: A solid, more or less rigid object of metal or wood with a uniform cross-section smaller than its length.
bar.example: The window was protected by steel bars.

barbecue.definition: A fireplace or pit for grilling food, typically used outdoors and traditionally employing hot charcoal as the heating medium.
barbecue.example: We cooked our food on the barbecue.

barber.definition: A person whose profession is cutting (usually male) customers' hair and beards.

bargain.definition: An agreement between parties concerning the sale of property; or a contract by which one party binds himself to transfer the right to some property for a consideration, and the other party binds himself to receive the property and pay the consideration.

barn.definition: A building, often found on a farm, used for storage or keeping animals such as cattle.

base.definition: Something from which other things extend; a foundation.

baseball.definition: A sport common in North America, the Caribbean, and Japan, in which the object is to strike a ball so that one of a nine-person team can run counter-clockwise among four bases, resulting in the scoring of a run. The team with the most runs after termination of play, usually nine innings, wins.

basket.definition: A lightweight container, generally round, open at the top, and tapering toward the bottom.
basket.example: A basket of fake fruit adorned the table.

basketball.definition: A sport in which two opposing teams of five players strive to put a ball through a hoop.

bass.definition: A low spectrum of sound tones.
bass.example: Peter adjusted the equalizer on his audio equipment to emphasize the bass.

bat.definition: Any of the flying mammals of the order Chiroptera, usually small and nocturnal, insectivorous or frugivorous.

bathroom.definition: A room containing a shower and/or bathtub, and (typically but not necessarily) a toilet.

bathtub.definition: A large container for holding water in which a person may bathe (take a bath).

battery.definition: A device used to power electric devices, consisting of a set of electrically connected electrochemical or, archaically, electrostatic cells. A single such cell when used by itself.

battleship.definition: Large capital warship displacing tens of thousands of tons, heavily armoured and armed with big guns. Battleships are now obsolescent, replaced by smaller vessels with guided missiles. Types: dreadnought, pre-dreadnought.

beach.definition: The shore of a body of water, especially when sandy or pebbly.

beam.definition: Any large piece of timber or iron long in proportion to its thickness, and prepared for use.

bean.definition: A reusable software component written in Java.

beanstalk.definition: The stem of a bean plant, proverbially fast-growing and tall.

bear.definition: A large omnivorous mammal, related to the dog and raccoon, having shaggy hair, a very small tail, and flat feet; a member of family Ursidae.

beard.definition: Facial hair on the chin, cheeks, jaw and neck.

beaver.definition: A semiaquatic rodent of the genus Castor, having a wide, flat tail and webbed feet.

bed.definition: A piece of furniture, usually flat and soft, on which to rest or sleep.
bed.example:
My cat often sleeps on my bed.
I keep a glass of water next to my bed when I sleep.

bedbug.definition: A small nocturnal insect (Cimex lectularius), of the family Cimicidae, that feeds on the blood of humans and other warm-blooded hosts.

bedrock.definition: The solid rock that exists at some depth below the ground surface. Bedrock is rock "in place", as opposed to material that has been transported from another location by weathering and erosion.

bedroom.definition: A room in a house where a bed is kept for sleeping.
bedroom.example: Please don't enter my bedroom without knocking.

bee.definition: A flying insect, of the clade Anthophila within the hymenopteran superfamily Apoidea, known for its organised societies (though only a minority have them), for collecting pollen and (in some species) producing wax and honey.

beehive.definition: A 12- to 13-year-old participant in the Young Women organization of the LDS Church.

beer.definition: An alcoholic drink fermented from starch material, commonly barley malt, often with hops or some other substance to impart a bitter flavor.
beer.example: Beer is brewed all over the world.

bell.definition: A percussive instrument made of metal or other hard material, typically but not always in the shape of an inverted cup with a flared rim, which resonates when struck.

belt.definition: A band worn around the waist to hold clothing to one's body (usually pants), hold weapons (such as a gun or sword), or serve as a decorative piece of clothing.
belt.example: As part of the act, the fat clown's belt broke, causing his pants to fall down.

bench.definition: A long seat with or without a back, found for example in parks and schools.
bench.example: They sat on a park bench and tossed bread crumbs to the ducks and pigeons.

bend.example: There's a sharp bend in the road ahead.

bet.definition: A wager, an agreement between two parties that a stake (usually money) will be paid by the loser to the winner (the winner being the one who correctly forecast the outcome of an event).
bet.example: Dylan owes Fletcher $30 from an unsuccessful bet.

bib.definition: An item of clothing for people (especially babies) tied around their neck to protect their clothes from getting dirty when eating.

bicycle.definition: A vehicle that has two wheels, one behind the other, a steering handle, and a saddle seat or seats and is usually propelled by the action of a rider’s feet upon pedals.

bid.definition: To issue a command; to tell.

bike.definition: A vehicle that has two wheels, one behind the other, a steering handle, and a saddle seat or seats and is usually propelled by the action of a rider’s feet upon pedals.

bikini.definition: A brief two-piece bathing suit worn by women, especially one that exposes the midriff and navel.

bill.definition: Any of various bladed or pointed hand weapons, originally designating an Anglo-Saxon sword, and later a weapon of infantry, especially in the 14th and 15th centuries, commonly consisting of a broad, heavy, double-edged, hook-shaped blade, with a short pike at the back and another at the top, attached to the end of a long staff.

bird.definition: A member of the class of animals Aves in the phylum Chordata, characterized by being warm-blooded, having feathers and wings usually capable of flight, and laying eggs.

birthday.definition: The anniversary of the day on which someone is born.

biscuit.definition: (rare in the US) A small, flat, baked good which is either hard and crisp or else soft but firm: a cookie.

bit.definition: A piece of metal placed in a horse's mouth and connected to the reins to direct the animal.
bit.example: A horse hates having a bit put in its mouth.

bitter.definition: (usually in the plural bitters) A liquid or powder, made from bitter herbs, used in mixed drinks or as a tonic.

black.definition: The colour/color perceived in the absence of light, but also when no light is reflected, but rather absorbed.

blackberry.definition: A fruit-bearing shrub of the species Rubus fruticosus and some hybrids.

blackbird.definition: A common true thrush, Turdus merula, found in woods and gardens over much of Eurasia, and introduced elsewhere.

blackboard.definition: A large flat surface, finished with black slate or a similar material, that can be written upon with chalk and subsequently erased; a chalkboard.

blackjack.definition: A common gambling card game in casinos, where the object is to get as close to 21 without going over.

blade.definition: The sharp cutting edge of a knife, chisel, or other tool, a razor blade/sword.

blanket.definition: A heavy, loosely woven fabric, usually large and woollen, used for warmth while sleeping or resting.
blanket.example: The baby was cold, so his mother put a blanket over him.

blender.definition: A machine outfitted with sharp blades, for mashing, crushing or liquefying food ingredients.

blind.definition: A covering for a window to keep out light. The covering may be made of cloth or of narrow slats that can block light or allow it to pass.

blizzard.definition: A large snowstorm accompanied by strong winds and greatly reduced visibility caused by blowing snow.

block.definition: A substantial, often approximately cuboid, piece of any substance.

blood.definition: A member of the Los Angeles gang The Bloods.

blouse.definition: A shirt, typically loose and reaching from the neck to the waist.

blowfish.definition: Any species of fish of the family Tetraodontidae that have the ability to inflate themselves to a globe several times their normal size by swallowing water or air when threatened.

blueberry.definition: An edible round berry, belonging to the cowberry group (Vaccinium sect. Cyanococcus), with flared crowns at the end, that turns blue on ripening.

blueprint.definition: A type of paper-based reproduction process producing white-on-blue images, used primarily for technical and architecture's drawings, now largely replaced by other technologies.

blues.definition: The colour of the clear sky or the deep sea, between green and violet in the visible spectrum, and one of the primary additive colours for transmitted light; the colour obtained by subtracting red and green from white light using magenta and cyan filters; or any colour resembling this.

boa.definition: Any of a group of large American snakes, of the genus Boa, subfamily Boinae, or family Boidae, including the boa constrictor, the emperor boa of Mexico, and the chevalier boa of Peru.

board.definition: A relatively long, wide and thin piece of any material, usually wood or similar, often for use in construction or furniture-making.

boat.definition: A craft used for transportation of goods, fishing, racing, recreational cruising, or military use on or in the water, propelled by oars or outboard motor or inboard motor or by wind.

bobsled.definition: A sled used to go down a bob track.

boil.definition: A localized accumulation of pus in the skin, resulting from infection.

boldface.definition: A font that is dark, having a high ratio of ink to white space, written or drawn with thick strong lines.

bomb.definition: An explosive device used or intended as a weapon.

bone.definition: A composite material consisting largely of calcium phosphate and collagen and making up the skeleton of most vertebrates.

bonnet.definition: A type of hat, once worn by women or children, held in place by ribbons tied under the chin.

bonus.definition: Something extra that is good; an added benefit.

book.definition: A collection of sheets of paper bound together to hinge at one edge, containing printed or written material, pictures, etc.
book.example: He was frustrated because he couldn't find anything about dinosaurs in the book.

bookcase.definition: A piece of furniture for the storage and display of books.

bookshelf.definition: A shelf or shelves for storing books for easy visual reference.

bookstore.definition: A store where books are bought and sold.

bookworm.definition: Any of various insects that infest books.

boomerang.definition: A flat curved airfoil, that spins about an axis perpendicular to the direction of flight, that was originally used in various parts of the world as hunting weapons or, in returnable types, for sports or training.

boot.definition: A heavy shoe that covers part of the leg.

booth.definition: A small stall for the display and sale of goods.

boss.definition: A person who oversees and directs the work of others; a supervisor.

bottle.definition: A container, typically made of glass or plastic and having a tapered neck, used primarily for holding liquids.
bottle.example: Beer is often sold in bottles.

bottom.example: Footers appear at the bottoms of pages.

bow.definition: A weapon made of a curved piece of wood or other flexible material whose ends are connected by a string, used for shooting arrows.

bowl.definition: A roughly hemispherical container used to hold, mix or present food, such as salad, fruit or soup, or other items.

bowtie.definition: A man's necktie tied in a bow around the throat.

box.definition: Senses relating to a three-dimensional object or space.

boxer.definition: A participant (fighter) in a boxing match.
boxer.example: You can tell she's a boxer by looking at her nose.

boy.example: Kate is dating a boy named Jim.

bracelet.definition: A band or chain worn around the wrist as jewelry/jewellery or an ornament.

brag.definition: A boast or boasting; bragging; ostentatious pretence or self-glorification.

braid.definition: A sudden movement; a jerk, a wrench.

brain.definition: The control center of the central nervous system of an animal located in the skull which is responsible for perception, cognition, attention, memory, emotion, and action.

branch.definition: The woody part of a tree arising from the trunk and usually dividing.

brass.definition: A metallic alloy of copper and zinc used in many industrial and plumbing applications.

bread.definition: A foodstuff made by baking dough made from cereals.

break.definition: An instance of breaking something into two or more pieces.
break.example: The femur has a clean break and so should heal easily.

breakfast.definition: The first meal of the day, usually eaten in the morning.
breakfast.example: You should put more protein in her breakfast so she will grow.

breath.definition: The act or process of breathing.
breath.example: I could hear the breath of the runner behind me.

brick.definition: A hardened rectangular block of mud, clay etc., used for building.
brick.example: This wall is made of bricks.

bride.definition: A woman in the context of her own wedding; one who is going to marry or has just been married.

bridge.definition: A construction or natural feature that spans a divide.

broom.definition: A domestic utensil with fibers bound together at the end of a long handle, used for sweeping.

brother.definition: Son of the same parents as another person.

bruise.definition: A purplish mark on the skin due to leakage of blood from capillaries under the surface that have been damaged by a blow.

brush.definition: An implement consisting of multiple more or less flexible bristles or other filaments attached to a handle, used for any of various purposes including cleaning, painting, and arranging hair.

bubble.definition: A spherically contained volume of air or other gas, especially one made from soapy liquid.

bucket.definition: A container made of rigid material, often with a handle, used to carry liquids or small items.
bucket.example: I need a bucket to carry the water from the well.

buckle.definition: To distort or collapse under physical pressure; especially, of a slender structure in compression.

buddy.example: They have been buddies since they were in school.

budget.definition: The amount of money or resources earmarked for a particular institution, activity or time-frame.

buffalo.definition: Any of the Old World mammals of the family Bovidae, such as the Cape buffalo, Syncerus caffer, or the water buffalo Bubalus bubalis.

bug.definition: An insect of the order Hemiptera (the “true bugs”).

building.definition: The act or process by which something is built; construction.
building.example: The building of the bridge will be completed in a couple of weeks.

bulb.definition: Any solid object rounded at one end and tapering on the other, possibly attached to a larger object at the tapered end.

bull.definition: An adult male of domesticated cattle or oxen.

bulldozer.definition: A tractor with an attached blade for pushing earth and building debris for coarse preliminary surface grading, demolishing building structures, etc.

bumblebee.definition: Any of several species of large bee in the genus Bombus

bunch.definition: A group of similar things, either growing together, or in a cluster or clump, usually fastened together.
bunch.example: a bunch of grapes;  a bunch of bananas;  a bunch of keys;  a bunch of yobs on a street corner

burrito.definition: A Mexican dish consisting of a flour tortilla wrapped around a filling of meat and/or beans, cheese etc.

bus.definition: A motor vehicle for transporting large numbers of people along roads.

business.definition: A specific commercial enterprise or establishment.
business.example: I was left my father's business.

butter.definition: A soft, fatty foodstuff made by churning the cream of milk (generally cow's milk).

butterfly.definition: A flying insect of the order Lepidoptera, distinguished from moths by their diurnal activity and generally brighter colouring.

button.definition: One who adjusts, especially for the insurance industry's employment title "loss adjuster" (or "claims adjuster" in the United States).

buy.definition: Something which is bought; a purchase.
buy.example: At only $30, the second-hand kitchen table was a great buy.

cabin.definition: A small dwelling characteristic of the frontier, especially when built from logs with simple tools and not constructed by professional builders, but by those who meant to live in it.
cabin.example: Abraham Lincoln was born in a log cabin.

cabinet.definition: A storage closet either separate from, or built into, a wall.

cable.definition: (material) A long object used to make a physical connection.

cactus.definition: Any member of the family Cactaceae, a family of flowering New World succulent plants suited to a hot, semi-desert climate.

cafe.definition: A convenience store, originally one that sold coffee and similar basic items.

cake.definition: A rich, sweet dessert food, typically made of flour, sugar and eggs and baked in an oven, and often covered in icing.

calendar.definition: Any system by which time is divided into days, weeks, months, and years.
calendar.example: The three principal calendars are the Gregorian, Jewish, and Islamic calendars.

calm.definition: (in a person) The state of being calm; peacefulness; absence of worry, anger, fear or other strong negative emotion.

camera.definition: A device for taking still or moving pictures or photographs.

camp.definition: An outdoor place acting as temporary accommodation in tents or other temporary structures.

campaign.definition: A series of operations undertaken to achieve a set goal.
campaign.example: The company is targeting children in their latest advertising campaign.

can.definition: (auxiliary verb, defective) To know how to; to be able to.
can.example: She can speak English, French, and German.   I can play football.   Can you remember your fifth birthday?

cancer.definition: A disease in which the cells of a tissue undergo uncontrolled (and often rapid) proliferation.

candidate.definition: A person who is running in an election.

candle.definition: A light source consisting of a wick embedded in a solid, flammable substance such as wax, tallow, or paraffin.

candy.definition: Edible, sweet-tasting confectionery containing sugar, or sometimes artificial sweeteners, and often flavored with fruit, chocolate, nuts, herbs and spices, or artificial flavors.

cane.definition: A plant with simple stems, like bamboo or sugar cane, or the stem thereof

cannon.definition: A complete assembly, consisting of an artillery tube and a breech mechanism, firing mechanism or base cap, which is a component of a gun, howitzer or mortar. It may include muzzle appendages.

canoe.definition: A small long and narrow boat, propelled by one or more people (depending on the size of canoe), using single-bladed paddles. The paddlers face in the direction of travel, in either a seated position, or kneeling on the bottom of the boat. Canoes are open on top, and pointed at both ends.

cap.definition: A close-fitting hat, either brimless or peaked.
cap.example: The children were all wearing caps to protect them from the sun.

cape.definition: A piece or point of land, extending beyond the adjacent coast into a sea or lake; a promontory; a headland.

capital.definition: Already-produced durable goods available for use as a factor of production, such as steam shovels (equipment) and office buildings (structures).

car.definition: A wheeled vehicle that moves independently, with at least three wheels, powered mechanically, steered by a driver and mostly for personal transportation.
car.example: She drove her car to the mall.

cardboard.definition: A wood-based material resembling heavy paper, used in the manufacture of boxes, cartons and signs.

career.definition: One's calling in life; a person's occupation; one's profession.

cargo.definition: Freight carried by a ship, aircraft, or motor vehicle.

carpet.definition: A fabric used as a complete floor covering.

carrot.definition: A vegetable with a nutritious, juicy, sweet root that is often orange in colour, Daucus carota, especially the subspecies sativus in the family Apiaceae.

carry.definition: A manner of transporting or lifting something; the grip or position in which something is carried.
carry.example: Adjust your carry from time to time so that you don't tire too quickly.

cartography.definition: The creation of charts and maps based on the layout of a territory's geography.

cartoon.definition: A humorous drawing, often with a caption, or a strip of such drawings.

case.definition: An actual event, situation, or fact.
case.example: For a change, in this case, he was telling the truth.

cash.definition: Money in the form of notes/bills and coins, as opposed to cheques/checks or electronic transactions.
cash.example: After you bounced those checks last time, they want to be paid in cash.

cashier.definition: To dismiss (someone, especially military personnel) from service

casino.definition: A public building or room for entertainment, especially gambling.

castle.definition: A large building that is fortified and contains many defences; in previous ages often inhabited by a nobleman or king.

cat.definition: An animal of the family Felidae:

catalog.definition: A systematic list of names, books, pictures etc.

catch.definition: The act of seizing or capturing.
catch.example: The catch of the perpetrator was the product of a year of police work.

category.definition: A group, often named or numbered, to which items are assigned based on similarity or defined criteria.
category.example: I wouldn't put this book in the same category as the author's first novel.

cause.definition: (often with of, typically of adverse results) The source of, or reason for, an event or action; that which produces or effects a result.
cause.example: They identified a burst pipe as the cause of the flooding.

cave.definition: A large, naturally-occurring cavity formed underground or in the face of a cliff or a hillside.
cave.example: We found a cave on the mountainside where we could take shelter.

ceiling.definition: To line or finish (a surface, such as a wall), with plaster, stucco, thin boards, or similar.

celery.definition: A European herb (Apium graveolens) of the carrot family.

cell.definition: A single-room dwelling for a hermit.

cello.definition: A large stringed instrument of the violin family with four strings, tuned from lowest to highest C-G-D-A, and played with a bow, also possessing an endpin to support the instrument's weight.

century.definition: A period of 100 consecutive years; often specifically a numbered period with conventional start and end dates, e.g., the twentieth century, which stretches from (strictly) 1901 through 2000, or (informally) 1900 through 1999. The first century AD was from 1 to 100.

cereal.definition: A type of grass (such as wheat, rice or oats) cultivated for its edible grains.

chain.definition: A series of interconnected rings or links usually made of metal.
chain.example: He wore a gold chain around the neck.

chainsaw.definition: A saw that has a power-driven and fast-revolving chain of metal teeth, usually used to cut trees.
chainsaw.example: He used a chainsaw to cut through the fallen tree on the roadway.

chair.definition: An item of furniture used to sit on or in, comprising a seat, legs, back, and sometimes arm rests, for use by one person. Compare stool, couch, sofa, settee, loveseat and bench.
chair.example: All I need to weather a snowstorm is hot coffee, a warm fire, a good book and a comfortable chair.

chamber.definition: A room or set of rooms, particularly:

champion.definition: An ongoing winner in a game or contest.
champion.example: The defending champion is expected to defeat his challenger.

chance.example: We had the chance to meet the president last week.

chandelier.definition: A branched, often ornate, lighting fixture suspended from the ceiling

channel.definition: The physical confine of a river or slough, consisting of a bed and banks.
channel.example: The water coming out of the waterwheel created a standing wave in the channel.

chapter.definition: (authorship) One of the main sections into which the text of a book is divided.
chapter.example: Detective novel writers try to keep up the suspense until the last chapter.

charger.definition: A device that charges or recharges
charger.example: Put the batteries in the charger overnight so we can use them tomorrow.

charity.definition: An organization, the objective of which is to carry out a charitable purpose.

cheek.definition: The soft skin on each side of the face, below the eyes; the outer surface of the sides of the oral cavity.

cheerleader.definition: A person, usually a young, attractive female, who encourages applause and cheers at a sports event, and wearing a specially-designed uniform in the official colors of the team he/she cheers for.

cheese.definition: A dairy product made from curdled or cultured milk.

cheeseburger.definition: A hamburger containing cheese (usually one or more slices of processed cheese).

cheesecake.definition: A pie made of sweetened and flavoured cottage cheese or cream cheese, eggs and milk on a crunchy base.
cheesecake.example: Cheesecake is an especially delicious dessert.

chef.definition: The presiding cook in the kitchen of a large household.

chemistry.definition: The branch of natural science that deals with the composition and constitution of substances and the changes that they undergo as a consequence of alterations in the constitution of their molecules.

cherry.definition: A small fruit, usually red, black or yellow, with a smooth hard seed and a short hard stem.

chess.definition: A board game for two players with each beginning with sixteen chess pieces moving according to fixed rules across a chessboard with the objective to checkmate the opposing king.

chest.definition: A box, now usually a large strong box with a secure convex lid.
chest.example: The clothes are kept in a chest.

chestnut.definition: A tree or shrub of the genus Castanea.

chicken.definition: A domestic fowl, Gallus gallus, especially when young.

child.definition: A person who has not yet reached adulthood, whether natural (puberty), cultural (initiation), or legal (majority)
child.example: Go easy on him: he is but a child.

chime.definition: A musical instrument producing a sound when struck, similar to a bell (e.g. a tubular metal bar) or actually a bell. Often used in the plural to refer to the set: the chimes.
chime.example: Hugo was a chime player in the school orchestra.

chimney.definition: A vertical tube or hollow column used to emit environmentally polluting gaseous and solid matter (including but not limited to by-products of burning carbon or hydrocarbon based fuels); a flue.

chin.definition: The bottom of a face, (specifically) the typically jutting jawline below the mouth.

chip.definition: A small piece broken from a larger piece of solid material.

chocolate.definition: A food made from ground roasted cocoa beans.
chocolate.example: Chocolate is a very popular treat.

chop.definition: A cut of meat, often containing a section of a rib.
chop.example: I only like lamb chops with mint jelly.

chopsticks.definition: A particular East Asian eating utensil, used in pairs and held in the hand. The utensil is a stick, usually made of wood and measuring approximately 23cm (10 inches) in length.

chord.definition: A harmonic set of three or more notes that is heard as if sounding simultaneously.

church.definition: A Christian house of worship; a building where Christian religious services take place.
church.example: There is a lovely little church in the valley.

cicada.definition: Any of several insects in the superfamily Cicadoidea, with small eyes wide apart on the head and transparent well-veined wings.

cigarette.definition: Tobacco or other substances, in a thin roll wrapped with paper, intended to be smoked.

cinema.definition: A movie theatre, a movie house
cinema.example: The cinema is right across the street from the restaurant.

circle.definition: A two-dimensional geometric figure, a line, consisting of the set of all those points in a plane that are equally distant from a given point (center).
circle.example: The set of all points (x, y) such that (x − 1)2 + y2 = r2 is a circle of radius r around the point (1, 0).

circus.definition: A traveling company of performers that may include acrobats, clowns, trained animals, and other novelty acts, that gives shows usually in a circular tent.
circus.example: The circus will be in town next week.

city.definition: A large settlement, bigger than a town; sometimes with a specific legal definition, depending on the place.
city.example: São Paulo is the largest city in South America.

clam.definition: A bivalve mollusk of many kinds, especially those that are edible; for example the soft-shell clam (Mya arenaria), the hard clam (Mercenaria mercenaria), the sea clam or hen clam (Spisula solidissima), and other species. The name is said to have been given originally to the Tridacna gigas, a huge East Indian bivalve.

class.definition: A group, collection, category or set sharing characteristics or attributes.
class.example: Often used to imply membership of a large class.

classroom.definition: A room, often in a school, where classes take place

claw.definition: A curved, pointed horny nail on each digit of the foot of a mammal, reptile, or bird.

clerk.definition: One who occupationally works with records, accounts, letters, etc.; an office worker.

click.definition: A brief, sharp, not particularly loud, relatively high-pitched sound produced by the impact of something small and hard against something hard, such as by the operation of a switch, a lock or a latch, or a finger pressed against the thumb and then released to strike the hand.
click.example: I turned the key, the lock gave a click and the door opened;  a click of one’s fingers

client.definition: A customer, a buyer or receiver of goods or services.

cliff.definition: A vertical (or nearly vertical) rock face.

climate.definition: An area of the earth's surface between two parallels of latitude.

cloak.definition: A long outer garment worn over the shoulders covering the back; a cape, often with a hood.

clock.definition: An instrument used to measure or keep track of time; a non-portable timepiece.

clog.definition: A type of shoe with an inflexible, often wooden sole sometimes with an open heel.
clog.example: Dutch people rarely wear clogs these days.

close.example: We owe them our thanks for bringing the project to a successful close.

closet.definition: Any private area, (particularly) bowers in the open air.

clothes.definition: A woven fabric such as used in dressing, decorating, cleaning or other practical use.

clown.definition: A slapstick performance artist often associated with a circus and usually characterized by bright, oversized clothing, a red nose, face paint, and a brightly colored wig.

club.definition: An association of members joining together for some common purpose, especially sports or recreation.

clue.definition: A strand of yarn etc. as used to guide one through a labyrinth; something which points the way, a guide.

coach.definition: A wheeled vehicle, generally drawn by horse power.

coal.definition: A black rock formed from prehistoric plant remains, composed largely of carbon and burned as a fuel.
coal.example: Put some coal on the fire.

coast.definition: The edge of the land where it meets an ocean, sea, gulf, bay, or large lake.
coast.example: The rocky coast of Maine has few beaches.

coat.definition: An outer garment covering the upper torso and arms.Wp

coconut.definition: A fruit of the coconut palm (not a true nut), Cocos nucifera, having a fibrous husk surrounding a large seed.

code.definition: A short symbol, often with little relation to the item it represents.
code.example: This flavour of soup has been assigned the code WRT-9.

coffee.definition: A beverage made by infusing the beans of the coffee plant in hot water.

coil.definition: Something wound in the form of a helix or spiral.
coil.example: the sinuous coils of a snake

coin.definition: (money) A piece of currency, usually metallic and in the shape of a disc, but sometimes polygonal, or with a hole in the middle.

cold.definition: (of a thing) Having a low temperature.
cold.example: A cold wind whistled through the trees.

college.definition: A corporate group; a group of colleagues.

comb.definition: A toothed implement for grooming the hair or (formerly) for keeping it in place.

comet.definition: A celestial body consisting mainly of ice, dust and gas in a (usually very eccentric) orbit around the Sun and having a "tail" of matter blown back from it by the solar wind as it approaches the Sun.

comfortable.definition: A stuffed or quilted coverlet for a bed; a comforter.

comment.example: I have no comment on that.

committee.definition: A body of one or more persons convened for the accomplishment of some specific purpose, typically with formal protocols.

community.definition: A group sharing a common understanding, and often the same language, law, manners, and/or tradition.

company.definition: A team; a group of people who work together professionally.

compass.definition: A magnetic or electronic device used to determine the cardinal directions (usually magnetic or true north).

computer.definition: A person employed to perform computations; one who computes.

concert.definition: Agreement in a design or plan; union formed by mutual communication of opinions and views; accordance in a scheme; harmony; simultaneous action.

cone.definition: A surface of revolution formed by rotating a segment of a line around another line that intersects the first line.

context.definition: The surroundings, circumstances, environment, background or settings that determine, specify, or clarify the meaning of an event or other occurrence.
context.example: In what context did your attack on him happen? - We had a pretty tense relationship at the time, and when he insulted me I snapped.

contract.definition: An agreement between two or more parties, to perform a specific job or work order, often temporary or of fixed duration and usually governed by a written agreement.

control.example: The government has complete control over the situation.

cook.example: I'm a terrible cook, so I eat a lot of frozen dinners.

cooker.definition: A device for heating food, a stove.

cookie.definition: A small, flat, baked good which is either crisp or soft but firm.

copy.definition: The result of copying; an identical duplicate of an original.
copy.example: Please bring me the copies of those reports.

cord.definition: A harmonic set of three or more notes that is heard as if sounding simultaneously.

cork.definition: The bark of the cork oak, which is very light and porous and used for making bottle stoppers, flotation devices, and insulation material.

corn.definition: The main cereal plant grown for its grain in a given region, such as oats in parts of Scotland and Ireland, and wheat or barley in England and Wales.

corndog.definition: A hot dog coated in cornbread batter and deep-fried in hot oil.

corner.definition: The point where two converging lines meet; an angle, either external or internal.
corner.example: The corners of the wire mesh were reinforced with little blobs of solder.

costume.definition: A style of dress, including garments, accessories and hairstyle, especially as characteristic of a particular country, period or people.
costume.example: The dancer was wearing Highland costume.

cotton.definition: Gossypium, a genus of plant used as a source of cotton fiber.

couch.definition: Couch grass, a species of persistent grass, Elymus repens, usually considered a weed.

cough.definition: A sudden, usually noisy expulsion of air from the lungs, often involuntary.
cough.example: Behind me, I heard a distinct, dry cough.

country.definition: (chiefly British) An area of land; a district, region.

county.definition: The land ruled by a count or a countess.

couple.definition: Two partners in a romantic or sexual relationship.

courage.definition: The quality of being confident, not afraid or easily intimidated, but without being incautious or inconsiderate.
courage.example: It takes a lot of courage to be successful in business.

course.example: The normal course of events seems to be just one damned thing after another.

court.definition: An enclosed space; a courtyard; an uncovered area shut in by the walls of a building, or by different buildings; also, a space opening from a street and nearly surrounded by houses; a blind alley.
court.example: The girls were playing in the court.

cousin.definition: The child of a person's uncle or aunt; a first cousin.
cousin.example: I think my cousin is a good man.

cow.definition: (properly) An adult female of the species Bos taurus, especially one that has calved.

cowboy.definition: A man who tends free-range cattle, especially in the American West.

crab.definition: A crustacean of the infraorder Brachyura, having five pairs of legs, the foremost of which are in the form of claws, and a carapace.

cracker.definition: A dry, thin, crispy baked bread (usually salty or savoury, but sometimes sweet, as in the case of graham crackers and animal crackers).

crane.definition: Any bird of the family Gruidae, large birds with long legs and a long neck which is extended during flight.

crater.definition: A hemispherical pit created by the impact of a meteorite or other object.

crayon.definition: A stick of colored chalk or wax used for drawing.

cream.definition: The butterfat/milkfat part of milk which rises to the top; this part when separated from the remainder.
cream.example: Take 100 ml of cream and 50 grams of sugar…

credit.definition: Reliance on the truth of something said or done; faith; trust.

crest.definition: The summit of a hill or mountain ridge.

crew.definition: To make the shrill sound characteristic of a rooster; to make a sound in this manner, either in gaiety, joy, pleasure, or defiance.

crib.definition: A baby’s bed with high, often slatted, often moveable sides, suitable for a child who has outgrown a cradle or bassinet.

cricket.definition: An insect in the order Orthoptera, especially family Gryllidae, that makes a chirping sound by rubbing its wing casings against combs on its hind legs.

criminal.definition: A person who is guilty of a crime, notably breaking the law.

crisp.definition: A thin slice of fried potato eaten as a snack.

cross.definition: A geometrical figure consisting of two straight lines or bars intersecting each other such that at least one of them is bisected by the other.
cross.example: Put a cross for a wrong answer and a tick for a right one.

crossbow.definition: A mechanised weapon, based on the bow and arrow, that shoots bolts.

crossover.definition: A place where one thing crosses over another.

crow.definition: A bird, usually black, of the genus Corvus, having a strong conical beak, with projecting bristles; it has a harsh, croaking call.

crown.definition: A royal, imperial or princely headdress; a diadem.

cruise.definition: A sea or lake voyage, especially one taken for pleasure.

crusader.definition: A fighter in the medieval Crusades.
crusader.example: the crusaders of the Middle Ages

crust.definition: A more solid, dense or hard layer on a surface or boundary.

crystal.definition: A solid composed of an array of atoms or molecules possessing long-range order and arranged in a pattern which is periodic in three dimensions.

cube.definition: A regular polyhedron having six identical square faces.

cubicle.definition: A small separate part or one of the compartments of a room, especially in a work environment.
cubicle.example: Most libraries provide cubicles for quiet study.

cuckoo.definition: The two-note sound made by the cuckoo.

cucumber.definition: A vine in the gourd family, Cucumis sativus.

cup.definition: A concave vessel for drinking from, usually made of opaque material (as opposed to a glass) and with a handle.
cup.example: Pour the tea into the cup.

cupcake.definition: A small cake baked in a paper container shaped like a cup, often with icing on top.

curb.definition: A concrete margin along the edge of a road; a kerb (UK, Australia, New Zealand)

curl.definition: A piece or lock of curling hair; a ringlet.

currency.definition: Money or other items used to facilitate transactions.
currency.example: Wampum was used as a currency by Amerindians.

current.definition: The generally unidirectional movement of a gas or fluid.

curry.definition: One of a family of dishes originating from South Asian cuisine, flavoured by a spiced sauce.

curtain.definition: A piece of cloth covering a window, bed, etc. to offer privacy and keep out light.

curve.definition: A gentle bend, such as in a road.
curve.example: You should slow down when approaching a curve.

cushion.definition: A soft mass of material stuffed into a cloth bag, used for comfort or support; for sitting on, kneeling on, resting one's head on etc.

customer.definition: A patron, a client; one who purchases or receives a product or service from a business or merchant, or intends to do so.
customer.example: Every person who passes by is a potential customer.

cut.example: He made a fine cut with his sword.

cycle.definition: An interval of space or time in which one set of events or phenomena is completed.
cycle.example: the cycle of the seasons, or of the year

czar.definition: An appointed official tasked to regulate or oversee a specific area.

dad.example: His dad was always there for him.

dagger.definition: A stabbing weapon, similar to a sword but with a short, double-edged blade.

daisy.definition: A wild flowering plant Bellis perennis of the Asteraceae family, with a yellow head and white petals

damage.definition: Injury or harm; the condition or measure of something not being intact.
damage.example: The storm did a lot of damage to the area.

dance.definition: A sequence of rhythmic steps or movements usually performed to music, for pleasure or as a form of social interaction.

dandelion.definition: Any of the several species of plant in the genus Taraxacum, characterised by yellow flower heads and notched, broad-ended leaves, especially the common dandelion (Taraxacum officinale).

darkness.definition: The state of being dark; lack of light.
darkness.example: The darkness of the room made it difficult to see.

dart.definition: A pointed missile weapon, intended to be thrown by the hand, for example a short lance or javelin

dash.definition: Any of the following symbols: ‒ (figure dash), – (en dash), — (em dash), or ― (horizontal bar).

dashboard.definition: A panel under the windscreen of a motor car or aircraft, containing indicator dials, compartments, and sometimes controls.

data.definition: (plural: data) A measurement of something on a scale understood by both the recorder (a person or device) and the reader (another person or device). The scale is arbitrarily defined, such as from 1 to 10 by ones, 1 to 100 by 0.1, or simply true or false, on or off, yes, no, or maybe, etc.

database.definition: (general) A collection of (usually) organized information in a regular structure, usually but not necessarily in a machine-readable format accessible by a computer.
database.example: I have a database of all my contacts in my personal organizer.

date.definition: The fruit of the date palm, Phoenix dactylifera, somewhat in the shape of an olive, containing a soft, sweet pulp and enclosing a hard kernel.
date.example: We made a nice cake from dates.

daughter.example: I already have a son, so I would like to have a daughter.

dawn.definition: The morning twilight period immediately before sunrise.

day.example: I've been here for two days and a bit.

daylight.definition: The light from the Sun, as opposed to that from any other source.

dead.definition: (with "the", a demonstrative, or a possessive) Those who have died.

deadline.definition: A time limit in the form of a date on or before which something must be completed.
deadline.example: I must make this deadline or my boss will kill me!

dealer.definition: One who deals in goods, especially automobiles; a middleman.
dealer.example: That used car dealer gave me a great deal on my 1962 rusted-out Volkswagen bug!

death.definition: The cessation of life and all associated processes; the end of an organism's existence as an entity independent from its environment and its return to an inert, nonliving state.
death.example: The death of my grandmother saddened the whole family.

debate.definition: An argument, or discussion, usually in an ordered or formal setting, often with more than two people, generally ending with a vote or other decision.
debate.example: After a four-hour debate, the committee voted to table the motion.

debt.definition: An action, state of mind, or object one has an obligation to perform for another, adopt toward another, or give to another.

deep.definition: (with "the") The deep part of a lake, sea, etc.

deer.definition: A ruminant mammal with antlers and hooves of the family Cervidae, or one of several similar animals from related families of the order Artiodactyla

degree.definition: A stage of proficiency or qualification in a course of study, now especially an award bestowed by a university or, in some countries, a college, as a certification of academic achievement. (In the United States, can include secondary schools.)
degree.example: She has two bachelor's degrees and is studying towards a master's degree.

dew.definition: Any moisture from the atmosphere condensed by cool bodies upon their surfaces.

delay.definition: A period of time before an event occurs; the act of delaying; procrastination; lingering inactivity.
delay.example: the delay before the echo of a sound

delivery.example: The delivery was completed by four.

delta.definition: The fourth letter of the modern Greek alphabet Δ, δ.

demand.definition: The desire to purchase goods and services.
demand.example: Prices usually go up when demand exceeds supply.

dent.definition: A shallow deformation in the surface of an object, produced by an impact.
dent.example: The crash produced a dent in the left side of the car.

dentist.definition: A medical doctor who specializes in dentistry.

deodorant.definition: Any agent acting to eliminate, reduce, mask, or control odor.

depression.definition: In psychotherapy and psychiatry, a state of mind producing serious, long-term lowering of enjoyment of life or inability to visualize a happy future.
depression.example: I used to suffer from depression, but now I'm mostly content with my life.

depth.definition: The vertical distance below a surface; the degree to which something is deep
depth.example: Measure the depth of the water in this part of the bay.

designer.definition: A person who designs something, or who designs things as a profession.

desire.example: It is my desire to speak with you.

desk.definition: A table, frame, or case, in past centuries usually with a sloping top but now usually with a flat top, for the use of writers and readers. It often has a drawer or repository underneath.

desktop.definition: The top surface of a desk.

detective.definition: (law enforcement) A police officer who looks for evidence as part of solving a crime; an investigator.

detention.definition: The act of detaining or the state of being detained.

detergent.example: Apply the cleansing cream to your skin.

device.definition: Any piece of equipment made for a particular purpose, especially a mechanical or electrical one.
device.example: There are a number of household devices in a kitchen such as a dishwasher, a garbage disposal, or an electric can opener.

devious.definition: Cunning or deceiving, not straightforward or honest, not frank

diagonal.definition: A line joining non-adjacent vertices of a polygon.

diamond.definition: A glimmering glass-like mineral that is an allotrope of carbon in which each atom is surrounded by four others in the form of a tetrahedron.
diamond.example: The saw is coated with diamond.

dictionary.definition: A reference work with a list of words from one or more languages, normally ordered alphabetically, explaining each word's meaning, and sometimes containing information on its etymology, pronunciation, usage, translations, and other data.

diet.definition: The food and beverage a person or animal consumes.
diet.example: The diet of the Giant Panda consists mainly of bamboo.

difference.example: You need to learn to be more tolerant of difference.

dimension.definition: A single aspect of a given thing.

dimple.definition: A small depression or indentation in a surface.
dimple.example: The accident created a dimple in the hood of the car.

dinner.definition: A midday meal (in a context in which the evening meal is called supper or tea).

dinosaur.definition: In scientific usage, any of the animals belonging to the clade Dinosauria, especially those that existed during the Triassic, Jurassic and Cretaceous periods and are now extinct.

director.definition: One who directs; the person in charge of managing a department or directorate (e.g., director of engineering), project, or production (as in a show or film, e.g., film director).

disaster.definition: An unexpected natural or man-made catastrophe of substantial extent causing significant physical damage or destruction, loss of life or sometimes permanent change to the natural environment.
disaster.example: People would suffer disasters when society's morality degenerates.

discount.example: This store offers discounts on all its wares. That store specializes in discount wares, too.

discovery.example: This latest discovery should eventually lead to much better treatments for disease.

disease.definition: An abnormal condition of a human, animal or plant that causes discomfort or dysfunction; distinct from injury insofar as the latter is usually instantaneously acquired.
disease.example: The tomato plants had some kind of disease that left their leaves splotchy and fruit withered.

disgust.definition: An intense dislike or loathing someone feels for something bad or nasty.
disgust.example: With an air of disgust, she stormed out of the room.

dish.definition: A vessel such as a plate for holding or serving food, often flat with a depressed region in the middle.

disk.definition: A thin, flat, circular plate or similar object.
disk.example: A coin is a disk of metal.

distance.definition: The amount of space between two points, usually geographical points, usually (but not necessarily) measured along a straight line.
distance.example: From Moscow, the distance is relatively short to Saint Petersburg, relatively long to Novosibirsk, but even greater to Vladivostok.

district.definition: An administrative division of an area.

ditch.definition: A trench; a long, shallow indentation, as for irrigation or drainage.
ditch.example: Digging ditches has long been considered one of the most demanding forms of manual labor.

dive.definition: A jump or plunge into water.
dive.example: the dive of a hawk after prey

doctor.definition: A physician; a member of the medical profession; one who is trained and licensed to heal the sick or injured. The final examination and qualification may award a doctor degree in which case the post-nominal letters are D.O., DPM, M.D., DMD, DDS, in the US or MBBS in the UK.
doctor.example: If you still feel unwell tomorrow, see your doctor.

document.definition: An original or official paper used as the basis, proof, or support of anything else, including any writing, book, or other instrument conveying information pertinent to such proof or support.

dog.definition: A mammal, Canis familiaris or Canis lupus familiaris, that has been domesticated for thousands of years, of highly variable appearance due to human breeding.
dog.example: The dog barked all night long.

doghouse.definition: Any small house or structure or enclosure used to house a dog.

doll.definition: A toy in the form of a human.

dollar.definition: Official designation for currency in some parts of the world, including Canada, the United States, Australia, New Zealand, Hong Kong, and elsewhere. Its symbol is $.

dolphin.definition: A carnivorous aquatic mammal in one of several families of order Cetacea, famed for its intelligence and occasional willingness to approach humans.

dominoes.definition: A tile divided into two squares, each having 0 to 6 (or sometimes more) dots or pips (as in dice), used in the game of dominoes.

donkey.definition: A domestic animal, Equus asinus asinus, similar to a horse

door.definition: A portal of entry into a building, room, or vehicle, consisting of a rigid plane movable on a hinge. Doors are frequently made of wood or metal. May have a handle to help open and close, a latch to hold the door closed and a lock that ensures the door cannot be opened without the key.
door.example: I knocked on the vice president's door

doormat.definition: A coarse mat at the entrance to a house, upon which one wipes one's shoes.
doormat.example: Wipe your shoes on the doormat before you start plodding around in the house.

double.definition: Twice the number, amount, size, etc.

doubt.definition: Disbelief or uncertainty (about something); a particular instance of such disbelief or uncertainty.
doubt.example: I have doubts about how to convert this code to JavaScript.

doughnut.definition: A deep-fried piece of dough or batter, commonly of a toroidal (a ring doughnut) shape, often mixed with various sweeteners and flavourings; or flattened sphere (a filled doughnut) shape filled with jam, custard or cream.

downhill.definition: The fastest of the disciplines of alpine skiing.

download.definition: A file transfer to the local computer.
download.example: The download took longer than I expected.

draft.definition: A current of air, usually coming into a room or vehicle.

drag.definition: Resistance of the air (or some other fluid) to something moving through it.
drag.example: When designing cars, manufacturers have to take drag into consideration.

dragon.definition: A legendary serpentine or reptilian creature.

dragonfly.definition: An insect of the suborder Epiprocta or, more strictly, the infraorder Anisoptera, having four long transparent wings held perpendicular to a long body when perched.

drain.definition: A conduit allowing liquid to flow out of an otherwise contained volume; a plughole (UK)
drain.example: The drain in the kitchen sink is clogged.

drama.definition: A composition, normally in prose, telling a story and intended to be represented by actors impersonating the characters and speaking the dialogue

drawbridge.definition: A hinged bridge which can be raised (to prevent its being crossed, as across a moat, or to allow watercraft to travel beneath it).

drawer.definition: An open-topped box that can be slid in and out of the cabinet that contains it, used for storing clothing or other articles.

dream.definition: Imaginary events seen in the mind while sleeping.

dress.definition: An item of clothing (usually worn by a woman or young girl) which both covers the upper part of the body and includes skirts below the waist.
dress.example: Amy and Mary looked very pretty in their dresses.

dresser.definition: An item of kitchen furniture, like a cabinet with shelves, for storing crockery or utensils.

dressing.definition: Material applied to a wound for protection or therapy.

drink.definition: To consume (a liquid) through the mouth.
drink.example: He drank the water I gave him.

drip.definition: To fall one drop at a time.
drip.example: Listening to the tap next door drip all night drove me mad!

driver.definition: One who drives something, in any sense of the verb to drive.

drone.definition: A male ant, bee or wasp, which does not work but can fertilize the queen bee.

drop.definition: A small quantity of liquid, just large enough to hold its own round shape via surface tension, especially one that falls from a source of liquid.
drop.example: Put three drops of oil into the mixture.

drought.definition: A period of unusually low rainfall, longer and more severe than a dry spell.

drum.definition: A percussive musical instrument spanned with a thin covering on at least one end for striking, forming an acoustic chamber, affecting what materials are used to make it; a membranophone.

drumstick.definition: A stick used to play drums.

dryer.definition: One who, or that which, dries; a desiccative.
dryer.example: The sun and a northwesterly wind are great driers of the earth.

duck.definition: To quickly lower the head or body in order to prevent it from being struck by something.

dumbbell.definition: A weight training implement consisting of a short bar with weight counterpoised on each end.

dustpan.definition: A flat scoop with a short handle, into which dust, dirt and other material is conveyed with a brush or broom.

dwarf.definition: Any member of a race of beings from (especially Scandinavian and other Germanic) folklore, usually depicted as having some sort of supernatural powers and being skilled in crafting and metalworking, often as short with long beards, and sometimes as clashing with elves.

dynamite.definition: A class of explosives made from nitroglycerine in an absorbent medium such as kieselguhr, used in mining and blasting; invented by Alfred Nobel in 1867.

eagle.definition: Any of several large carnivorous and carrion-eating birds in the family Accipitridae, having a powerful hooked bill and keen vision.

early.definition: A shift (scheduled work period) that takes place early in the day.

earring.definition: A piece of jewelry worn on the ear.

ears.definition: The organ of hearing, consisting of the pinna, auditory canal, eardrum, malleus, incus, stapes and cochlea.

earth.definition: The third planet of the Solar System; the world upon which humans live.

earthquake.definition: A shaking of the ground, caused by volcanic activity or movement around geologic faults.

earthworm.definition: A worm that lives in the ground.

easel.definition: An upright frame, typically on three legs, for displaying or supporting something, such as an artist's canvas.

east.definition: One of the four principal compass points, specifically 90°, conventionally directed to the right on maps; the direction of the rising sun at an equinox. Abbreviated as E.

eat.definition: Something to be eaten; a meal; a food item.

eclipse.definition: An alignment of astronomical objects whereby one object comes between the observer (or notional observer) and another object, thus obscuring the latter.

economy.definition: Effective management of a community or system, or especially its resources.

edge.definition: The boundary line of a surface.

editor.definition: A person who edits or makes changes to documents.

eel.definition: Any freshwater or marine fish of the order Anguilliformes, which are elongated and resemble snakes.

eerie.example: The eerie sounds seemed to come from the graveyard after midnight.

effort.definition: The work involved in performing an activity; exertion.
effort.example: It took a lot of effort to find a decent-sized, fully-furnished apartment within walking distance of the office.   He made a conscious effort to not appear affected by the stories in the paper.

egg.definition: An approximately spherical or ellipsoidal body produced by birds, reptiles, insects and other animals, housing the embryo during its development.

elbow.definition: The joint between the upper arm and the forearm.

election.definition: A process of choosing a leader, members of parliament, councillors or other representatives by popular vote.
election.example: How did you vote in (UK also: at) the last election?

electricity.definition: Originally, a property of amber and certain other nonconducting substances to attract lightweight material when rubbed, or the cause of this property; now understood to be a phenomenon caused by the distribution and movement of charged subatomic particles and their interaction with the electromagnetic field.

elephant.definition: A mammal of the order Proboscidea, having a trunk, and two large ivory tusks jutting from the upper jaw.

eleven.definition: A cricket team of eleven players. Hence first eleven - the team of best cricket players (at a school), second eleven - the "B" team, etc.

emerald.definition: Any of various green gemstones, especially a green transparent form of beryl, highly valued as a precious stone.

emergency.definition: A situation which poses an immediate risk and which requires urgent attention.
emergency.example: Cardiac arrest is an emergency and if you find someone in cardiac arrest you should call 999 immediately.

emigrate.definition: To leave the country in which one lives, especially one's native country, in order to reside elsewhere.

emotion.definition: A person's internal state of being and involuntary physiological response to an object or a situation, based on or tied to physical state and sensory data.

emphasis.definition: Special weight or forcefulness given to something considered important.
emphasis.example: He paused for emphasis before saying who had won.

end.definition: The terminal point of something in space or time.
end.example: At the end of the road, turn left.

energy.definition: The impetus behind all motion and all activity.

engine.definition: A large construction used in warfare, such as a battering ram, catapult etc.

engineer.definition: A person who is qualified or professionally engaged in any branch of engineering.

entrance.definition: The action of entering, or going in.
entrance.example: Her entrance attracted no attention whatsoever.

equip.definition: To supply with something necessary in order to carry out a specific action or task; to provide with (e.g. weapons, provisions, munitions, rigging)

error.definition: The state, quality, or condition of being wrong.

essay.definition: (authorship) A written composition of moderate length, exploring a particular issue or subject.

estate.definition: The collective property and liabilities of someone, especially a deceased person.

evening.definition: The time of the day between dusk and night, when it gets dark.

evidence.definition: Facts or observations presented in support of an assertion.
evidence.example: There is no evidence that anyone was here earlier.

excite.example: The fireworks which opened the festivities excited anyone present.

exercise.definition: Any activity designed to develop or hone a skill or ability.
exercise.example: The teacher told us that the next exercise is to write an essay.

exert.example: I exerted myself in today's training.

exit.definition: An act of going out or going away, or leaving; a departure.
exit.example: He made his exit at the opportune time.

expert.definition: A person with extensive knowledge or ability in a given subject.
expert.example: We called in several experts on the subject, but they couldn't reach an agreement.

exponent.definition: One who expounds, represents or advocates.

eyes.definition: An organ through which animals see (perceive surroundings via light).
eyes.example: Bright lights really hurt my eyes.

eyewitness.definition: Someone who sees an event and can report or testify about it.

face.definition: The front part of the head of a human or other animal, featuring the eyes, nose and mouth, and the surrounding area.
face.example: That girl has a pretty face.

fact.definition: Something actual as opposed to invented.
fact.example: In this story, the Gettysburg Address is a fact, but the rest is fiction.

factory.definition: A trading establishment, especially set up by merchants working in a foreign country.

fade.definition: A golf shot that (for the right-handed player) curves intentionally to the right. See slice, hook, draw.

fail.example: The project was full of fail.

fall.definition: The act of moving to a lower position under the effect of gravity.

family.definition: A group of people who are closely related to one another (by blood, marriage or adoption); kin; for example, a set of parents and their children; an immediate family.

fan.definition: A hand-held device consisting of concertinaed material, or slats of material, gathered together at one end, that may be opened out into the shape of a sector of a circle and waved back and forth in order to move air towards oneself and cool oneself.

fang.definition: A long, pointed canine tooth used for biting and tearing flesh

far.example: He went to a far land.

farm.definition: A place where agricultural and similar activities take place, especially the growing of crops or the raising of livestock.

farmer.definition: A person who works the land and/or who keeps livestock, especially on a farm.

fat.definition: A specialized animal tissue with a high oil content, used for long-term storage of energy.

father.definition: A (generally human) male who begets a child.
father.example: My father was a strong influence on me.

fear.definition: A strong, uncontrollable, unpleasant emotion or feeling caused by actual or perceived danger or threat.
fear.example: He was struck by fear on seeing the snake.

fee.definition: (feudal law) A right to the use of a superior's land, as a stipend for services to be performed; also, the land so held; a fief.

feedback.definition: Critical assessment of a process or activity or of their results.
feedback.example: After you hand in your essays, I will give both grades and feedback.

festival.definition: An event or community gathering, usually staged by a local community, which centers on some theme, sometimes on some unique aspect of the community.

fetch.definition: An act of fetching, of bringing something from a distance.

fever.definition: A higher than normal body temperature of a person (or, generally, a mammal), usually caused by disease.
fever.example: "I have a fever. I think I've the flu."

fiber.definition: A single elongated piece of a given material, roughly round in cross-section, often twisted with other fibers to form thread.
fiber.example: The microscope showed a single blue fiber stuck to the sole of the shoe.

fiddle.definition: Any of various bowed string instruments, often a violin when played in any of various traditional styles, as opposed to classical violin.
fiddle.example: When I play it like this, it's a fiddle; when I play it like that, it's a violin.

field.definition: A land area free of woodland, cities, and towns; open country.
