field.example: There are several species of wild flowers growing in this field.

fight.definition: To contend in physical conflict, either singly or in war, battle etc.
fight.example: A wounded animal will fight like a maniac, relentless, savage and murderous.

figure.definition: A drawing or diagram conveying information.

file.definition: A collection of papers collated and archived together.

film.definition: A thin layer of some substance; a pellicle; a membranous covering, causing opacity.
film.example: a clear plastic film for wrapping food

finance.definition: The management of money and other assets.

finger.definition: A slender jointed extremity of the human hand, exclusive of the thumb.
finger.example: Humans have two hands and ten fingers. Each hand has one thumb and four fingers.

fire.definition: A (usually self-sustaining) chemical reaction involving the bonding of oxygen with carbon or other fuel, with the production of heat and the presence of flame or smouldering.

firearm.definition: A personal weapon that uses explosive powder to propel a projectile often made of lead.

firecracker.definition: A small explosive device, typically containing a small amount of gunpowder in a tightly-wound roll of paper, primarily designed to produce a large bang.

firefighter.definition: A person who puts out fires.

firefly.definition: Any beetle of the family Lampyridae, which exhibit bioluminescence during twilight.

fireworks.definition: A device using gunpowder and other chemicals which, when lit, emits a combination of coloured flames, sparks, whistles or bangs, and sometimes made to rocket high into the sky before exploding, used for entertainment or celebration.
fireworks.example: Commercial firework displays are commonly launched from boats or other vessels

fish.definition: A cold-blooded vertebrate animal that lives in water, moving with the help of fins and breathing with gills.

fishbowl.definition: A small, rounded, transparent, and domestic aquarium.

fist.definition: A hand with the fingers clenched or curled inward.
fist.example: The boxer's fists rained down on his opponent in the last round.

five.example: He wrote a five followed by four zeroes.

fizz.definition: An emission of a rapid stream of bubbles.
fizz.example: I poured a cola and waited for the fizz to settle down before topping off the glass.

flag.definition: A piece of cloth, often decorated with an emblem, used as a visual signal or symbol.

flagpole.definition: A tall pole up which one or more flags may be raised and flown.

flame.definition: The visible part of fire; a stream of burning vapour or gas, emitting light and heat.

flamingo.definition: A wading bird of the family Phoenicopteridae.

flea.definition: A small, wingless, parasitic insect of the order Siphonaptera, renowned for its bloodsucking habits and jumping abilities.

flight.example: Most birds are capable of flight.

fling.definition: An act of throwing, often violently.

flip.definition: A maneuver which rotates an object end over end.
flip.example: The diver did a couple of flips before landing in the pool.

float.definition: A buoyant device used to support something in water or another liquid.
float.example: Attach the float and the weight to the fishing line, above the hook.

flood.definition: A (usually disastrous) overflow of water from a lake or other body of water due to excessive rainfall or other input of water.

floor.definition: The interior bottom or surface of a house or building; the supporting surface of a room.
floor.example: The room has a wooden floor.

flour.definition: Powder obtained by grinding or milling cereal grains, especially wheat, or other foodstuffs such as soybeans and potatoes, and used to bake bread, cakes, and pastry.

flower.definition: A colorful, conspicuous structure associated with angiosperms, frequently scented and attracting various insects, and which may or may not be used for sexual reproduction.

flute.definition: A woodwind instrument consisting of a tube with a row of holes that produce sound through vibrations caused by air blown across the edge of the holes, often tuned by plugging one or more holes with a finger; the Western concert flute, a transverse side-blown flute of European origin.

flutter.definition: The act of fluttering; quick and irregular motion.

fly.definition: Any insect of the order Diptera; characterized by having two wings (except for some wingless species), also called true flies.

foam.definition: A substance composed of a large collection of bubbles or their solidified remains.
foam.example: He doesn't like so much foam in his beer.

focus.definition: A point at which reflected or refracted rays of light converge.
focus.example: The heat of sunlight at the focus of a magnifying glass can easily set dry leaves on fire.

fog.definition: A thick cloud that forms near the ground; the obscurity of such a cloud.

foil.definition: A very thin sheet of metal.

food.definition: Any solid substance that can be consumed by living organisms, especially by eating, in order to sustain life.
food.example: The innkeeper brought them food and drink.

foot.definition: A biological structure found in many animals that is used for locomotion and that is frequently a separate organ at the terminal part of the leg.

football.definition: (general) A sport played on foot in which teams attempt to get a ball into a goal or zone defended by the other team.
football.example: Roman and medieval football matches were more violent than any modern type of football.

footprint.definition: The impression of the foot in a soft substance such as sand or snow.

force.definition: Strength or energy of body or mind; active power; vigour; might; capacity of exercising an influence or producing an effect.
force.example: the force of an appeal, an argument, or a contract

forehead.definition: The part of the face above the eyebrows and below the hairline.

forest.definition: A dense uncultivated tract of trees and undergrowth, larger than woods.

forge.definition: Furnace or hearth where metals are heated prior to hammering them into shape.

fork.definition: A pronged tool having a long straight handle, used for digging, lifting, throwing etc.

forklift.definition: A small industrial vehicle with a power-operated fork-like pronged platform that can be raised and lowered for insertion under a load, often on pallets, to be lifted and moved

fortune.example: She read my fortune. Apparently I will have a good love life this week, but I will have a bad week for money.

fountain.definition: A natural source of water; a spring.

fox.definition: A red fox, small carnivore (Vulpes vulpes), related to dogs and wolves, with red or silver fur and a bushy tail.
fox.example: The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog.

frame.definition: The structural elements of a building or other constructed object.
frame.example: Now that the frame is complete, we can start on the walls.

freezer.definition: An appliance or room used to store food or other perishable items at temperatures below 0° Celsius (32° Fahrenheit).

friction.definition: The rubbing of one object or surface against another.

friend.definition: A person other than a family member, spouse or lover whose company one enjoys and towards whom one feels affection.
friend.example: John and I have been friends ever since we were roommates at college.   Trust is important between friends.   I used to find it hard to make friends when I was shy.

fries.definition: (usually in the plural, fries) A fried strip of potato.

fright.definition: A state of terror excited by the sudden appearance of danger; sudden and violent fear, usually of short duration; a sudden alarm.

frock.definition: A dress, a piece of clothing for a female, which consists of a skirt and a cover for the upper body.

frog.definition: A small tailless amphibian of the order Anura that typically hops.

front.definition: The foremost side of something or the end that faces the direction it normally moves.

frost.definition: A cover of minute ice crystals on objects that are exposed to the air. Frost is formed by the same process as dew, except that the temperature of the frosted object is below freezing.

fruit.definition: (often in the plural) In general, a product of plant growth useful to man or animals.

fuel.definition: Substance consumed to provide energy through combustion, or through chemical or nuclear reaction.

full.definition: Containing the maximum possible amount that can fit in the space available.
full.example: The jugs were full to the point of overflowing.

fund.definition: A sum or source of money.
fund.example: a fund for the maintenance of underprivileged students

funeral.definition: A ceremony to honour and remember a deceased person. Often distinguished from a memorial service by the presence of the body of the deceased.
funeral.example: Many mourners turned up at the local artist's funeral to pay homage.

fur.definition: The hairy coat of various mammal species, especially when fine, soft and thick.

future.definition: The time ahead; those moments yet to be experienced.

galaxy.definition: The Milky Way; the apparent band of concentrated stars which appears in the night sky over earth.

gallon.definition: A unit of volume, equivalent to eight pints

gallop.definition: The fastest gait of a horse, a two-beat stride during which all four legs are off the ground simultaneously.

gangster.definition: A member of a criminal or street gang.

gap.definition: An opening in anything made by breaking or parting.
gap.example: He made a gap in the fence by kicking at a weak spot.

garage.definition: A building (or section of a building) used to store a car or cars, tools and other miscellaneous items.

garbage.definition: Food waste material of any kind.
garbage.example: Garbage is collected on Tuesdays; rubbish on Fridays

garden.definition: An outdoor area containing one or more types of plants, usually plants grown for food or ornamental purposes.
garden.example: a vegetable garden  a flower garden

garlic.definition: A plant, Allium sativum, related to the onion, having a pungent bulb much used in cooking.

gas.definition: Matter in a state intermediate between liquid and plasma that can be contained only if it is fully surrounded by a solid (or in a bubble of liquid) (or held together by gravitational pull); it can condense into a liquid, or can (rarely) become a solid directly.
gas.example: A lot of gas had escaped from the cylinder.

gasoline.definition: A flammable liquid consisting of a mixture of refined petroleum hydrocarbons, mainly used as a motor fuel; petrol.

gate.definition: A doorlike structure outside a house.

gear.definition: Equipment or paraphernalia, especially that used for an athletic endeavor.

gene.definition: A theoretical unit of heredity of living organisms; a gene may take several values and in principle predetermines a precise trait of an organism's form (phenotype), such as hair color.

genie.definition: A jinn, a being descended from the jann, normally invisible to the human eye, but who may also appear in animal or human form.

gentleman.definition: A man of gentle but not noble birth, particularly a man of means (originally ownership of property) who does not work for a living but has no official status in a peerage; an armiferous man ranking below a knight.
gentleman.example: Being a gentleman, Robert was entitled to shove other commoners into the gongpit but he still had to jump out of the way of the knights to avoid the same fate himself.

germ.definition: The small mass of cells from which a new organism develops; a seed, bud or spore.

ghost.definition: The spirit; the soul of man.

gift.definition: Something given to another voluntarily, without charge.

ginger.definition: The pungent aromatic rhizome of a tropical Asian herb, Zingiber officinale, used as a spice and as a stimulant and acarminative.

giraffe.definition: A ruminant, of the genus Giraffa, of the African savannah with long legs and highly elongated neck, which make it the tallest living animal; yellow fur patterned with dark spots, often in the form of a network; and two or more short, skin-covered horns, so-called; strictly speaking the horn-like projections are ossicones.

girl.definition: A female child, adolescent, or a young woman.

girlfriend.definition: A female partner in an unmarried romantic relationship.
girlfriend.example: Marc went to the park with his girlfriend and watched the sunset with her.

glacier.definition: A large body of ice which flows under its own mass, usually downhill.
glacier.example: They warned that the effects of glacier melting on water resources are becoming “increasingly serious” for China.

gladiator.definition: (in ancient Rome) A person (professional or slave) who entertained the public by engaging in mortal combat with another, or with a wild animal.

glasses.example: to fibreglass the hull of a fishing-boat

glitter.definition: A bright, sparkling light; shininess or brilliance.

globe.example: the globe of the eye; the globe of a lamp

gloves.definition: An item of clothing other than a mitten, covering all or part of the hand and fingers, but usually allowing independent movement of the fingers.
gloves.example: I wore gloves to keep my hands warm.

glue.definition: A hard gelatin made by boiling bones and hides, used in solution as an adhesive; or any sticky adhesive substance.

goal.definition: A result that one is attempting to achieve.
goal.example: My lifelong goal is to get into a Hollywood movie.

goalkeeper.definition: A designated player that attempts to prevent the opposing team from scoring by protecting a goal.

goat.definition: A mammal, Capra aegagrus hircus, and similar species of the genus Capra.

goblin.definition: One of various hostile supernatural creatures, now especially (fantasy literature) a malevolent and grotesque diminutive humanoid.

god.definition: A being such as a monotheistic God: a single divine creator and ruler of the universe.

goggles.definition: Protective eyewear set in a flexible frame to fit snugly against the face.
goggles.example: Goggles must be worn in the swimming pool.

gold.definition: A heavy yellow elemental metal of great value, with atomic number 79 and symbol Au.

goldfish.definition: A type of small fish, Carassius auratus, typically orange-colored.
goldfish.example: For the children's fair we'll have a few games they can play, so that each child "wins" a goldfish as a prize.

golf.definition: A ball game played by individuals competing against one another in which the object is to hit a ball into each of a series of (usually 18 or nine) holes in the minimum number of strokes.

gorilla.definition: The largest of the apes, native to the forests of central Africa, and known for their trait of knuckle-walking.

government.definition: The body with the power to make and/or enforce laws to control a country, land area, people or organization.

grade.example: I gave him a good grade for effort.

grain.definition: The harvested seeds of various grass food crops eg: wheat, corn, barley.
grain.example: We stored a thousand tons of grain for the winter.

grapes.definition: A small, round, smooth-skinned edible fruit, usually purple, red, or green, that grows in bunches on vines of genus Vitis.

graph.definition: (applied mathematics) A data chart (graphical representation of data) intended to illustrate the relationship between a set (or sets) of numbers (quantities, measurements or indicative numbers) and a reference set, whose elements are indexed to those of the former set(s) and may or may not be numbers.

grass.definition: Any plant of the family Poaceae, characterized by leaves that arise from nodes in the stem and leaf bases that wrap around the stem, especially those grown as ground cover rather than for grain.

grasshopper.definition: A mostly herbivorous insect of the order Orthoptera, noted for its ability to jump long distances and for the habit of some species communicating by stridulation; they are related to but distinct from crickets.

green.example: The former flag of Libya is fully green.

greenhouse.definition: A building used to grow plants, particularly one with large glass windows or plastic sheeting to trap heat from sunlight even in intemperate seasons or climates.

grid.definition: A rectangular array of squares or rectangles of equal size, such as in a crossword puzzle.

grill.definition: A grating; a grid of wire or a sheet of material with a pattern of holes or slots, usually used to protect something while allowing the passage of air and liquids. Typical uses: to allow air through a fan while preventing fingers or objects from passing; to allow people to talk to somebody, while preventing attack.

grits.definition: (usually in the plural) Husked but unground oats.

grocery.definition: (usually groceries) retail foodstuffs and other household supplies.

groom.definition: A man who is about to marry.

ground.definition: The surface of the Earth, as opposed to the sky or water or underground.
ground.example: Look, I found a ten dollar bill on the ground!

group.definition: A number of things or persons being in some relation to one another.
group.example: A group of people gathered in front of the Parliament to demonstrate against the Prime Minister's proposals.

grow.definition: To become larger, to increase in magnitude.

grumpy.example: The old man was grumpy because he couldn’t find his glasses.

guest.definition: A recipient of hospitality, specifically someone staying by invitation at the house of another.
guest.example: The guests were let in by the butler.

guide.definition: Someone who guides, especially someone hired to show people around a place or an institution and offer information and explanation.
guide.example: The guide led us around the museum and explained the exhibits.

guitar.definition: A stringed musical instrument, of European origin, usually with a fretted fingerboard and six strings, played with the fingers or a plectrum (guitar pick).

gum.definition: (often in the plural) The flesh around the teeth.

guy.definition: An effigy of a man burned on a bonfire on the anniversary of the Gunpowder Plot (5th November).

habit.definition: An action performed on a regular basis.
habit.example: It’s become a habit of mine to have a cup of coffee after dinner.

haiku.definition: A Japanese poem in three lines, the first and last consisting of five morae, and the second consisting of seven morae, usually with an emphasis on the season or a naturalistic theme.

hail.definition: Balls or pieces of ice falling as precipitation, often in connection with a thunderstorm.

hair.definition: A pigmented filament of keratin which grows from a follicle on the skin of humans and other mammals.

hairbrush.definition: A brush used in hair care for brushing, tidying, and detangling hair

haircut.definition: The act of cutting of the hair, often done professionally by a barber, hair stylist, or beautician.

hairspray.definition: A usually scented hairstyling product in aerosol form that stiffens the hair, so it stays in a certain hairstyle.

half.definition: One of two usually roughly equal parts into which anything may be divided, or considered as divided.
half.example: I ate the slightly smaller half of the apple.

hall.example: The drinking fountain was out in the hall.

halt.definition: To limp; move with a limping gait.

hamburger.definition: A hot sandwich consisting of a patty of cooked ground beef or a meat substitute, in a sliced bun, sometimes also containing salad vegetables, condiments, or both.

hammer.definition: A tool with a heavy head and a handle used for pounding.
hammer.example: Bobby used a hammer and nails to fix the two planks together

hammerhead.definition: The portion of a hammer containing the metal striking face (also including the claw or peen if so equipped).

hand.definition: The part of the forelimb below the forearm or wrist in a human, and the corresponding part in many other animals.

handcuffs.definition: A fastening consisting of two metal rings, designed to go around a person's wrists, and connected by a chain or hinge.

handful.definition: The amount that a hand will grasp or contain.

handle.definition: The part of an object which is (designed to be) held in the hand when used or moved.

hang.definition: The way in which something hangs.
hang.example: This skirt has a nice hang.

happy.definition: A happy event, thing, person, etc.

harmonica.definition: A musical wind instrument with a series of holes for the player to blow into, each hole producing a different note

hat.definition: A covering for the head, often in the approximate form of a cone or a cylinder closed at its top end, and sometimes having a brim and other decoration.

hate.example: One of my pet hates is traffic wardens.

head.definition: The part of the body of an animal or human which contains the brain, mouth and main sense organs.
head.example: Be careful when you pet that dog on the head; it may bite.

headlight.definition: A bright light, with a lens and reflector, on the front of a motor vehicle (or originally a ship or train), designed to illuminate the road when driving at night; normally one of a pair.

headphones.definition: A pair of speakers worn over or in the ears so only the wearer can hear the sound.

headquarters.definition: The military installation from which troops are commanded and orders are issued; the military unit consisting of a commander and his support staff.

health.definition: The state of being free from physical or psychological disease, illness, or malfunction; wellness.
health.example: Her mental health is really affected by stressful environments.

hearing.definition: (stative) To perceive sounds through the ear.
hearing.example: I was deaf, and now I can hear.

heart.definition: A muscular organ that pumps blood through the body, traditionally thought to be the seat of emotion.

heat.example: This furnace puts out 5000 BTUs of heat.   That engine is really throwing off some heat.   Removal of heat from the liquid caused it to turn into a solid.

hedgehog.definition: A small mammal, of the family Erinaceidae or subfamily Erinaceinae (spiny hedgehog, the latter characterized by their spiny back and often by the habit of rolling up into a ball when attacked.)

heels.definition: The rear part of the foot, where it joins the leg.

height.definition: The distance from the base of something to the top.

helicopter.definition: An aircraft that is borne along by one or more sets of long rotating blades which allow it to hover, move in any direction including reverse, or land; and typically having a smaller set of blades on its tail that stabilize the aircraft.
helicopter.example: We flew over the city in a helicopter.

helium.definition: The second lightest chemical element (symbol He) with an atomic number of 2 and atomic weight of 4.002602, a colorless, odorless and inert noble gas.

helmet.definition: A protective head covering, usually part of armour.

hen.definition: A female chicken (Gallus gallus), particularly a sexually mature one kept for its eggs.

herbs.definition: Any green, leafy plant, or parts thereof, used to flavour or season food.

hermit.definition: A religious recluse; someone who lives alone for religious reasons; an eremite.

hiccup.definition: A spasm of the diaphragm, or the resulting sound.
hiccup.example: There was a loud hiccup from the back of the room and the class erupted in laughter.

hide.definition: To put (something) in a place where it will be harder to discover or out of sight.
hide.example: He hides his magazines under the bed.

highlight.definition: An area or a spot in a drawing, painting, or photograph that is strongly illuminated.

highway.definition: A motor vehicle for transporting large numbers of people along roads.

hill.definition: An elevated location smaller than a mountain.
hill.example: The park is sheltered from the wind by a hill to the east.

hippopotamus.definition: A large, semi-aquatic, herbivorous (plant-eating) African mammal (Hippopotamus amphibius)

historian.definition: A writer of history; a chronicler; an annalist.

history.example: History repeats itself if we don’t learn from its mistakes.

hit.definition: A blow; a punch; a striking against; the collision of one body against another; the stroke that touches anything.

hobby.definition: An activity that one enjoys doing in one's spare time.
hobby.example: I like to collect stamps from different countries as a hobby.

hockey.definition: Ice hockey, a game on ice in which two teams of six players skate and try to score by shooting a puck into the opposing team's net, using their sticks.

hole.definition: A hollow place or cavity; an excavation; a pit; an opening in or through a solid body, a fabric, etc.; a perforation; a rent; a fissure.
hole.example: There’s a hole in my shoe.  Her stocking has a hole in it.

holiday.definition: A day on which a festival, religious event, or national celebration is traditionally observed.

homeless.definition: Lacking a permanent place of residence.
homeless.example: Whenever I pass the park, I see the homeless people sleeping on the benches.

homer.definition: Various former units of volume, particularly:

homework.definition: Work that is done at home, especially school exercises assigned by a teacher.
homework.example: You must do your homework before you can watch television.

honey.definition: A viscous, sweet fluid produced from plant nectar by bees. Often used to sweeten tea or to spread on baked goods.

honeycomb.definition: A structure of hexagonal cells made by bees primarily of wax, to hold their larvae and for storing the honey to feed the larvae and to feed themselves during winter.

honeymoon.definition: The period of time immediately following a marriage.

honk.definition: The sound produced by a typical car horn.

hoof.definition: The tip of a toe of an ungulate such as a horse, ox or deer, strengthened by a thick keratin covering.

hook.definition: A rod bent into a curved shape, typically with one end free and the other end secured to a rope or other attachment.

hope.definition: To want something to happen, with a sense of expectation that it might.
hope.example: I am still hoping that all will turn out well.

hopscotch.definition: A child's game, in which a player, hopping on one foot, drives a stone from one compartment to another of a figure traced or scotched on the ground.

horn.definition: A hard growth of keratin that protrudes from the top of the head of certain animals, usually paired.

horror.definition: An intense distressing emotion of fear or repugnance.

horse.definition: Any of several animals related to Equus ferus caballus.

horseplay.definition: Rough or rowdy play that can often result in unintentional physical harm.

horsepower.definition: Power derived from the motion of a horse.

hose.definition: A flexible tube conveying water or other fluid.

hospital.definition: A large medical facility, usually in a building with multiple floors, where seriously ill or injured patients are given extensive medical and/or surgical treatment.

host.definition: One which receives or entertains a guest, socially, commercially, or officially.
host.example: A good host is always considerate of the guest’s needs.

hot.definition: (with up) To heat; to make or become hot.

hot-dog.definition: A sandwich consisting of a frankfurter, or wiener, in a bread roll, usually served with ketchup, mustard, relish, etc.

hotel.definition: A large town house or mansion; a grand private residence, especially in France.

hour.definition: A time period of sixty minutes; one twenty-fourth of a day.
hour.example: I spent an hour at lunch.

house.definition: A structure built or serving as an abode of human beings.
house.example: This is my house and my family's ancestral home.

houseboat.definition: A vessel, such as a barge, used as a dwelling.

howl.definition: The protracted, mournful cry of a dog or a wolf, or other like sound.

hug.definition: A close embrace, especially when charged with such an emotion as represented by: affection, joy, relief, lust, anger, agression, compassion, and the like, as opposed to being characterized by formality, equivocation or ambivalence (a half-embrace or "little hug").

hula.definition: A form of chant and dance, which was developed in the Hawaiian Islands by the Polynesians who originally settled there.

human.definition: A human being, whether man, woman or child.
human.example: Humans share common ancestors with other apes.

hurdle.definition: An artificial barrier, variously constructed, over which athletes or horses jump in a race.
hurdle.example: He ran in the 100 metres hurdles.

hurricane.definition: A severe tropical cyclone in the North Atlantic Ocean, Caribbean Sea, Gulf of Mexico, or in the eastern North Pacific off the west coast of Mexico, with winds of 119 km/h (74 miles per hour) or greater accompanied by rain, lightning, and thunder that sometimes moves into temperate latitudes.

husband.definition: The master of a house; the head of a family; a householder.

hut.definition: A small, simple one-storey dwelling or shelter, often with just one room, and generally built of readily available local materials.
hut.example: a thatched hut; a mud hut; a shepherd’s hut

hydrant.definition: An outlet from a liquid/fluid main often consisting of an upright pipe with a valve attached from which fluid (e.g. water or fuel) can be tapped.

hydrogen.definition: The lightest chemical element (symbol H), with an atomic number of 1 and atomic weight of 1.00794.

ice-cream.definition: A dessert made from frozen sweetened cream or a similar substance, usually flavoured.
ice-cream.example: Strawberries are particularly delicious with ice cream.

icicle.definition: A drooping, tapering shape of ice.

idea.definition: An abstract archetype of a given thing, compared to which real-life examples are seen as imperfect approximations; pure essence, as opposed to actual examples.

igloo.definition: A dome-shaped Inuit shelter, constructed of blocks cut from snow.

inch.definition: A unit of length equal to one twelfth of a foot, or exactly 2.54 centimetres.

inchworm.definition: The larva of a moth of the family Geometridae.

income.definition: Money one earns by working or by capitalising on the work of others.

independence.definition: The state or quality of being independent; freedom from dependence; exemption from reliance on, or control by others; self-subsistence or maintenance; direction of one's own affairs without interference.

industry.definition: The tendency to work persistently. Diligence.
industry.example: Over the years, their industry and business sense made them wealthy.

inflation.definition: An act, instance of, or state of expansion or increase in size, especially by injection of a gas.
inflation.example: The inflation of the balloon took five hours.

injury.definition: Damage to the body of a human or animal.
injury.example: The passenger sustained a severe injury in the car accident.

ink.definition: A pigment (or dye)-based fluid used for writing, printing etc.

inquisition.definition: An investigation or inquiry into the truth of some matter

insect.definition: An arthropod in the class Insecta, characterized by six legs, up to four wings, and a chitinous exoskeleton.
insect.example: Our shed has several insect infestions, including ants, yellowjackets, and wasps.

inside.example: The inside of the building has been extensively restored.

inspector.definition: A person employed to inspect something.

instance.definition: Urgency of manner or words; an urgent request; insistence.

insurance.definition: A means of indemnity against a future occurrence of an uncertain event.
insurance.example: The car was totalled, but fortunately I had insurance.

internet.definition: Any set of computer networks that communicate using the Internet Protocol. (An intranet.)

interview.definition: An official face-to-face meeting of monarchs or other important figures.

invest.definition: To spend money, time, or energy on something, especially for some benefit or purpose; used with in.
invest.example: We'd like to thank all the contributors who have invested countless hours into this event.

iron.definition: A common, inexpensive metal, silvery grey when untarnished, that rusts, is attracted by magnets, and is used in making steel.

irony.definition: A statement that, when taken in context, may actually mean something different from, or the opposite of, what is written literally; the use of words expressing something other than their literal intention, often in a humorous context.

island.definition: A contiguous area of land, smaller than a continent, totally surrounded by water.

ivy.definition: Any of several woody, climbing or trailing evergreen plants of the genus Hedera.

jacket.definition: A piece of clothing worn on the upper body outside a shirt or blouse, often waist length to thigh length.

jail.definition: A place or institution for the confinement of persons held in lawful custody or detention, especially for minor offenses or with reference to some future judicial proceeding.

jar.definition: An earthenware container, either with two or no handles, for holding oil, water, wine, etc., or used for burial.

jaw.definition: One of the bones, usually bearing teeth, which form the framework of the mouth.

jazz.definition: A musical art form rooted in West African cultural and musical expression and in the African American blues tradition, with diverse influences over time, commonly characterized by blue notes, syncopation, swing, call and response, polyrhythms and improvisation.

jeans.example: She wore a tattered jean jacket.

jellybean.definition: A small, bean-shaped, chewy candy/sweet with a firm coating and a jelly-like center, made of sugar, flavoring, coloring and sometimes starch or other thickener, and usually sold assorted in a wide variety of flavors and bright colors.

jellyfish.definition: An almost transparent aquatic animal; any one of the acalephs, especially one of the larger species, having a jellylike appearance.

jersey.definition: A garment knitted from wool, worn over the upper body.

jester.definition: One who jests, jokes or teases.

jewel.definition: A precious or semi-precious stone; gem, gemstone.

jigsaw.definition: A saw with fine teeth and a narrow blade which can cut curves in wood or metal.

job.example: A job half done is hardly done at all.

jog.definition: An energetic trot, slower than a run, often used as a form of exercise.

joint.definition: The point where two components of a structure join, but are still able to rotate.
joint.example: This rod is free to swing at the joint with the platform.

journalist.definition: The keeper of a personal journal, who writes in it regularly.

judge.definition: A public official whose duty it is to administer the law, especially by presiding over trials and rendering judgments; a justice.

juggle.definition: (juggling) The act of throwing and catching each prop at least twice, as opposed to a flash.

juice.definition: A liquid from a plant, especially fruit.
juice.example: Squeeze the orange and some juice will come out.

jump.definition: The act of jumping; a leap; a spring; a bound.

jungle.definition: A large, undeveloped, humid forest, especially in a tropical region, that is home to many wild plants and animals; a tropical rainforest.

junk.definition: Discarded or waste material; rubbish, trash.

jury.definition: A group of individuals chosen from the general population to hear and decide a case in a court of law.

kangaroo.definition: A member of the Macropodidae family of large marsupials with strong hind legs for hopping, native to Australia.

karate.definition: An Okinawan martial art involving primarily punching and kicking, but additionally, advanced throws, arm bars, grappling and all means of fighting.

ketchup.definition: A tomato-vinegar-based sauce, sometimes containing spices, onion or garlic, and (especially in the US) sweeteners.

key.definition: An object designed to open and close a lock.

keyboard.definition: (etc.) A set of keys used to operate a typewriter, computer etc.

kick.definition: A hit or strike with the leg, foot or knee.

kid.example: He treated the oxen like they didn't exist, but he treated the goat kid like a puppy.

kilogram.definition: In the International System of Units, the base unit of mass; conceived of as the mass of one litre of water, but now defined by taking the fixed numerical value of the Planck constant h to be 6.626 070 15 × 10-34 when expressed in units of kg⋅m2⋅s−1. Symbol: kg

kilt.definition: A traditional Scottish garment, usually worn by men, having roughly the same morphology as a wrap-around skirt, with overlapping front aprons and pleated around the sides and back, and usually made of twill-woven worsted wool with a tartan pattern.

king.definition: A male monarch; a man who heads a monarchy. If it's an absolute monarchy, then he is the supreme ruler of his nation.
king.example: Henry VIII was the king of England from 1509 to 1547.

kiss.definition: To touch with the lips or press the lips against, usually to show love or affection or passion, or as part of a greeting.

kitchen.definition: A room or area for preparing food.

kitten.definition: A young cat, especially before sexual maturity (reached at about seven months).

knee.definition: In humans, the joint or the region of the joint in the middle part of the leg between the thigh and the shank.
knee.example: Penny was wearing a miniskirt, so she skinned her exposed knees when she fell.

knife.definition: A utensil or a tool designed for cutting, consisting of a flat piece of hard material, usually steel or other metal (the blade), usually sharpened on one edge, attached to a handle. The blade may be pointed for piercing.

knight.definition: A young servant or follower; a trained military attendant in service of a lord.

knock.definition: Sudden fatigue as a result of glycogen depletion from not having taken in enough nutrition.

knot.definition: A looping of a piece of string or of any other long, flexible material that cannot be untangled without passing one or both ends of the material through its loops.
knot.example: Climbers must make sure that all knots are both secure and of types that will not weaken the rope.

koala.definition: A tree-dwelling marsupial, Phascolarctos cinereus, that resembles a small bear with a broad head, large ears and sharp claws, mainly found in eastern Australia.

lace.definition: A light fabric containing patterns of holes, usually built up from a single thread. Wp

ladder.definition: A frame, usually portable, of wood, metal, or rope, used for ascent and descent, consisting of two side pieces to which are fastened rungs (cross strips or rounds acting as steps).

lady.definition: An aristocratic title for a woman; the wife of a lord and/or a woman who holds the position in her own right; a title for a peeress, the wife of a peer or knight, and the daughters and daughters-in-law of certain peers.
lady.example: Sir John Smith and Lady Smith.

ladybug.definition: Any of the Coccinellidae family of beetles, typically having a round shape and red or yellow spotted elytra.

lake.definition: A small stream of running water; a channel for water; a drain.

lamp.definition: A device that generates heat, light or other radiation. Especially an electric light bulb.

lance.definition: A weapon of war, consisting of a long shaft or handle and a steel blade or head; a spear carried by horsemen.

land.definition: The part of Earth which is not covered by oceans or other bodies of water.

landfill.definition: A site at which refuse is buried under layers of earth.

landscape.definition: A portion of land or territory which the eye can comprehend in a single view, including all the objects it contains.

language.definition: A body of words, and set of methods of combining them (called a grammar), understood by a community and used as a form of communication.
language.example: Deaf and mute people communicate using languages like ASL.

lantern.definition: A case of translucent or transparent material made to protect a flame, or light, used to illuminate its surroundings.

laser.definition: A device that produces a monochromatic, coherent beam of light.

last.definition: Final, ultimate, coming after all others of its kind.
last.example: “Eyes Wide Shut” was the last film to be directed by Stanley Kubrick.

latitude.definition: The angular distance north or south from a planet's equator, measured along the meridian of that particular point.

laugh.definition: An expression of mirth particular to the human species; the sound heard in laughing; laughter.
laugh.example: His deep laughs boomed through the room.

law.definition: The body of binding rules and regulations, customs and standards established in a community by its legislative and judicial authorities.

lawnmower.definition: A device used for cutting grass to a chosen height, typically of landscaped lawns of residences or institutions.
lawnmower.example: We replaced our old electric lawnmower with a new cordless one.

lawyer.definition: A professional person qualified (as by a law degree or bar exam) and authorized to practice law, i.e. represent parties in lawsuits or trials and give legal advice.
lawyer.example: A lawyer's time and advice are his stock in trade. - aphorism often credited to Abraham Lincoln, but without attestation

layer.definition: A single thickness of some material covering a surface.
layer.example: After the first coat of paint dried, he applied another layer.

leader.definition: Any person that leads or directs

leaf.definition: The usually green and flat organ that represents the most prominent feature of most vegetative plants.

league.definition: A group or association of cooperating members.

leak.definition: A crack, crevice, fissure, or hole which admits water or other fluid, or lets it escape.

lean.definition: (of an object taller than its width and depth) An inclination away from the vertical.
lean.example: The trees had various leans toward gaps in the canopy.

leap.definition: The act of leaping or jumping.

leash.definition: A strap, cord or rope with which to restrain an animal, often a dog.

leather.definition: A tough material produced from the skin of animals, by tanning or similar process, used e.g. for clothing.

leave.definition: To have a consequence or remnant.

lecture.definition: A spoken lesson or exposition, usually delivered to a group.
lecture.example: During class today the professor delivered an interesting lecture.

legend.definition: An unrealistic story depicting past events.

legs.definition: A limb or appendage that an animal uses for support or locomotion.

lemonade.definition: A flavoured beverage consisting of water, lemon, and sweetener, sometimes ice, served mainly as a refreshment.

leprechaun.definition: (Irish folklore) One of a race of elves that can reveal hidden treasure to those who catch them.

lesson.definition: A section of learning or teaching into which a wider learning content is divided.
lesson.example: In our school a typical working week consists of around twenty lessons and ten hours of related laboratory work.

let.definition: The allowing of possession of a property etc. in exchange for rent.

letter.example: There are twenty-six letters in the English alphabet.

lettuce.definition: An edible plant, Lactuca sativa and its close relatives, having a head of green and/or purple leaves.

level.definition: A tool for finding whether a surface is level, or for creating a horizontal or vertical line of reference.
level.example: Hand me the level so I can tell if this is correctly installed.

liberty.definition: The condition of being free from control or restrictions.
liberty.example: The army is here, your liberty is assured.

librarian.definition: The keeper, manager of a library.

library.definition: An institution which holds books and/or other forms of media for use by the public or qualified people often lending them out, as well as providing various other services for its users.

lie.definition: The terrain and conditions surrounding the ball before it is struck.

life.definition: The state of organisms preceding their death, characterized by biological processes such as metabolism and reproduction and distinguishing them from inanimate objects; the state of being alive and living.
life.example: Having experienced both, the vampire decided that he preferred (un)death to life.  He gave up on life.

lifeboat.definition: A boat especially designed for saving the lives of shipwrecked people or people in distress at sea (either launched from the shore with a crew, or else carried on board a larger ship)

lifeguard.definition: A bodyguard or unit of bodyguards, a guard of someone's (especially a king's) life or person.

lifejacket.definition: An article of protective clothing that is designed to keep the wearer's head floating above the surface of the water.

light.definition: Visible electromagnetic radiation. The human eye can typically detect radiation (light) in the wavelength range of about 400 to 750 nanometers. Nearby shorter and longer wavelength ranges, although not visible, are commonly called ultraviolet and infrared light.
light.example: As you can see, this spacious dining-room gets a lot of light in the mornings.

lighter.definition: Having light; bright; clear; not dark or obscure.
lighter.example: The room is light when the Sun shines through the window.

lighthouse.definition: A tower or other structure exhibiting a light or lights to warn or guide sailors.

lightning.definition: A flash of light produced by short-duration, high-voltage discharge of electricity within a cloud, between clouds, or between a cloud and the earth.
lightning.example: Although we did not see the lightning, we did hear the thunder.

lightsaber.definition: A sword having a blade made of a powerful beam of light.

limerick.definition: A humorous, often bawdy verse of five anapaestic lines, with the rhyme scheme aabba, and typically having a 9–9–6–6–9 cadence.

limestone.definition: An abundant rock of marine and fresh-water sediments; primarily composed of calcite (CaCO3); it occurs in a variety of forms, both crystalline and amorphous.

limit.definition: A restriction; a bound beyond which one may not go.
limit.example: There are several existing limits to executive power.

line.definition: A path through two or more points (compare ‘segment’); a continuous mark, including as made by a pen; any path, curved or straight.
line.example: The arrow descended in a curved line.

link.definition: Some text or a graphic in an electronic document that can be activated to display another document or trigger an action.
link.example: Click the hyperlink to go to the next page.

lion.definition: A big cat, Panthera leo, native to Africa, India and formerly much of Europe.
lion.example: Tigers and lions share a common ancestor from a few million years ago.

lips.definition: Either of the two fleshy protrusions around the opening of the mouth.

lipstick.example: Are you wearing any lipstick today?

list.definition: A strip of fabric, especially from the edge of a piece of cloth.

listen.example: Give the motor a listen and tell me if it sounds off.

literature.definition: The body of all written works.

liver.definition: A large organ in the body that stores and metabolizes nutrients, destroys toxins and produces bile. It is responsible for thousands of biochemical reactions.
liver.example: Steve Jobs is a famous liver transplant recipient.

load.definition: A burden; a weight to be carried.
load.example: I struggled up the hill with the heavy load in my rucksack.

loaf.definition: (also loaf of bread) A block of bread after baking.

loan.definition: An act or instance of lending, an act or instance of granting something for temporary use.
loan.example: Because of the loan that John made to me, I was able to pay my tuition for the upcoming semester.

lobster.definition: A crustacean of the Nephropidae family, dark green or blue-black in colour turning bright red when cooked, with a hard shell and claws, which is used as a seafood.

location.definition: A particular point or place in physical space.

lock.definition: Something used for fastening, which can only be opened with a key or combination.

locket.definition: A pendant that opens to reveal a space used for storing a photograph or other small item.

locust.definition: Any of the grasshoppers, often polyphenic and usually swarming, in the family Acrididae that are very destructive to crops and other vegetation, (especially) the migratory locust (Locusta migratoria).

log.definition: The trunk of a dead tree, cleared of branches.
log.example: They walked across the stream on a fallen log.

logo.definition: A visual symbol or emblem that acts as a trademark or a means of identification of a company or organization.

lollipop.definition: An item of confectionery consisting of a piece of candy/sweet attached to a stick.

loop.definition: A length of thread, line or rope that is doubled over to make an opening.

loss.definition: The result of no longer possessing an object, a function, or a characteristic due to external causes or misplacement.
loss.example: In other areas, glacier loss creates serious risk of a dry period across the Third Pole, Wang said.

loveseat.definition: A small sofa for two people, British: two-seater settee.

luck.definition: Something that happens to someone by chance, a chance occurrence, especially a favourable one.
luck.example: Gilbert had some bad luck yesterday — he got pick-pocketed and lost fifty dollars.

luggage.definition: The bags and other containers that hold a traveller's belongings.

lumberjack.definition: A person whose work is to fell trees.

lunch.definition: A light meal usually eaten around midday, notably when not as main meal of the day.

lunchbox.definition: A container for transporting meals, especially lunch.

lungs.definition: A biological organ of vertebrates that controls breathing and oxygenates the blood.

macaroni.definition: A type of pasta in the form of short tubes; sometimes loosely, pasta in general.

machine.definition: A device that directs and controls energy, often in the form of movement or electricity, to produce a certain effect.

macho.definition: A macho person; a person who tends to display masculine characteristics, such as domineering, fierceness, and bravado.

magazine.definition: A non-academic periodical publication, generally consisting of sheets of paper folded in half and stapled at the fold.

magic.definition: The application of rituals or actions, especially those based on occult knowledge, to subdue or manipulate natural or supernatural beings and forces in order to have some benefit from them

magnet.definition: A piece of material that attracts some metals by magnetism.

mailbox.definition: A box into which mail is put

mailman.definition: Someone (implied male) who delivers mail to, and/or collects mail from, residential or commercial addresses, or from public mailboxes

maintenance.definition: Actions performed to keep some machine or system functioning or in service.

makeup.example: To understand how a nuclear reactor works, we must first look at its makeup.

mall.definition: A pedestrianised street, especially a shopping precinct.

mammoth.definition: Any species of the extinct genus Mammuthus, of large, usually hairy, elephant-like mammals with long curved tusks and an inclined back, which became extinct with the last retreat of ice age glaciers during the late Pleistocene period, and are known from fossils, frozen carcasses, and Paleolithic cave paintings found in North America and Eurasia.

man.example: The show is especially popular with middle-aged men.

manager.definition: A person whose job is to manage something, such as a business, a restaurant, or a sports team.

mango.definition: A tropical Asian fruit tree, Mangifera indica.

map.definition: A visual representation of an area, whether real or imaginary.

marathon.definition: A 42.195 kilometre (26 mile 385 yard) road race.

marker.definition: An object used to mark a location.

market.definition: A gathering of people for the purchase and sale of merchandise at a set time, often periodic.
market.example: The privilege to hold a weekly market was invaluable for any feudal era burgh.

marriage.example: You should enter marriage for love.

mascot.definition: Something thought to bring good luck
mascot.example: I keep this red stone as a lucky mascot and always put it on my desk in exams.,

mask.definition: A cover, or partial cover, for the face, used for disguise or protection.
mask.example: a dancer's mask; a fencer's mask; a ball player's mask

mast.definition: A tall, slim post or tower, usually tapering upward, used to support, for example, the sails on a ship, flags, floodlights, meteorological instruments ,or communications equipment such as an aerial, usually supported by guy-wires.

master.definition: Someone who has control over something or someone.

match.definition: A competitive sporting event such as a boxing meet, a baseball game, or a cricket match.
match.example: My local team are playing in a match against their arch-rivals today.

mate.definition: A fellow, comrade, colleague, partner or someone with whom something is shared, e.g. shipmate, classmate.

math.definition: A mowing; what is gathered from mowing.

mattress.definition: A pad on which a person can recline and sleep, usually having an inner section of coiled springs covered with foam or other cushioning material then enclosed with cloth fabric.

meal.definition: Food that is prepared and eaten, usually at a specific time, and usually in a comparatively large quantity (as opposed to a snack).
meal.example: Breakfast is the morning meal, lunch is the noon meal, and dinner, or supper, is the evening meal.

meaning.definition: (of words or symbols) The entity, perception, feeling or concept thereby represented or evoked.

meat.definition: The flesh (muscle tissue) of an animal used as food.
meat.example: A large portion of domestic meat production comes from animals raised on factory farms.

mechanic.definition: A manual worker; a labourer or artisan.

media.definition: The middle layer of the wall of a blood vessel or lymph vessel which is composed of connective and muscular tissue.

medicine.definition: A substance which specifically promotes healing when ingested or consumed in some way.

medium.definition: (plural media or mediums) The chemistry of the surrounding environment, e.g. solid, liquid, gas, vacuum, or a specific substance such as a solvent.

megaphone.definition: A portable, usually hand-held, funnel-shaped device that is used to amplify a person’s natural voice toward a targeted direction.

member.definition: One who officially belongs to a group.

memory.definition: The ability of the brain to record information or impressions with the facility of recalling them later at will.
memory.example: Memory is a facility common to all animals.

menu.definition: The details of the food to be served at a banquet; a bill of fare.

merchant.definition: A person who traffics in commodities for profit.

mermaid.definition: A mythological creature with a woman's head and upper body, and a tail of a fish.

mess.definition: A disagreeable mixture or confusion of things; hence, a situation resulting from blundering or from misunderstanding; disorder.
mess.example: He made a mess of it.

message.definition: A communication, or what is communicated; any concept or information conveyed.
message.example: We've just received an urgent message from the President.

metal.definition: (heading) Chemical elements or alloys, and the mines where their ores come from.

meter.definition: (always meter) A device that measures things.

method.definition: A process by which a task is completed; a way of doing something (followed by the adposition of, to or for before the purpose of the process):
method.example: If one method doesn't work, you should ask a friend to help you.

microscope.definition: An optical instrument used for observing small objects.

microwave.definition: An electromagnetic wave with wavelength between that of infrared light and radio waves.

midnight.definition: The middle of the night: the sixth temporal hour, equidistant between sunset and sunrise.

mile.definition: The international mile: a unit of length precisely equal to 1.609344 kilometers established by treaty among Anglophone nations in 1959, divided into 5,280 feet or 1,760 yards.

militia.definition: An army of trained civilians, which may be an official reserve army, called upon in time of need, the entire able-bodied population of a state which may also be called upon, or a private force not under government control.

milk.definition: A white liquid produced by the mammary glands of female mammals to nourish their young. From certain animals, especially cows, it is also called dairy milk and is a common food for humans as a beverage or used to produce various dairy products such as butter, cheese, and yogurt.

milkshake.definition: A thick beverage consisting of milk and ice cream mixed together, often with fruit, chocolate, or other flavoring.

mill.definition: A grinding apparatus for substances such as grains, seeds, etc.
mill.example: Pepper has a stronger flavor when it is ground straight from a mill.

mime.definition: A form of acting without words; pantomime.

mind.example: Despite advancing age, his mind was still as sharp as ever.

mine.definition: My; belonging to me; that which belongs to me.

minimum.example: We need a minimum of three staff members on duty at all time.

minion.example: We need a minimum of three staff members on duty at all time.

minute.definition: A unit of time equal to sixty seconds (one-sixtieth of an hour).
minute.example: You have twenty minutes to complete the test.

mirror.definition: A smooth surface, usually made of glass with reflective material painted on the underside, that reflects light so as to give an image of what is in front of it.
mirror.example: I had a look in the mirror to see if the blood had come off my face.

mission.definition: A set of tasks that fulfills a purpose or duty; an assignment set by an employer, or by oneself.

mitten.definition: A type of glove or garment that covers a hand with a separate sheath for the thumb, but not for other fingers, which are either enclosed in a single section or left uncovered.

moat.definition: A deep, wide defensive ditch, normally filled with water, surrounding a fortified habitation.

mobile.definition: A kinetic sculpture or decorative arrangement made of items hanging so that they can move independently from each other.

mode.definition: One of several ancient Greek scales.

model.definition: A person who serves as a subject for artwork or fashion, usually in the medium of photography but also for painting or drawing.
model.example: The beautiful model had her face on the cover of almost every fashion magazine imaginable.

mold.definition: A hollow form or matrix for shaping a fluid or plastic substance.

moment.definition: A brief, unspecified amount of time.
moment.example: Wait a moment, while I lock the front door.

money.definition: A legally or socially binding conceptual contract of entitlement to wealth, void of intrinsic value, payable for all debts and taxes, and regulated in supply.

monitor.definition: Someone who watches over something; a person in charge of something or someone.
monitor.example: The camp monitors look after the children during the night, when the teachers are asleep.

monkey.definition: Any member of the clade Simiiformes not also of the clade Hominoidea containing humans and apes, from which they are usually, but not universally, distinguished by smaller size, a tail, and cheek pouches.
monkey.example: He had been visiting an area zoo when a monkey swung from its tree perch, swiped his glasses and hurled them into a hippo hole.

month.definition: A period into which a year is divided, historically based on the phases of the moon.

monument.definition: A structure built for commemorative or symbolic reasons, or as a memorial; a commemoration.
monument.example: There is a monument on the town green to the soldiers who died in World War I.

mood.definition: A mental or emotional state, composure.
mood.example: I've been in a bad mood since I dumped my boyfriend.

moon.definition: The Earth's moon Luna; the sole natural satellite of the Earth, represented in astronomy and astrology by ☾.

moonlight.definition: (sometimes attributive) The light reflected from the Moon.

mop.definition: An implement for washing floors, or the like, made of a piece of cloth, or a collection of thrums, or coarse yarn, fastened to a handle.

morning.definition: The part of the day from dawn to noon.

mortgage.definition: A special form of secured loan where the purpose of the loan must be specified to the lender, to purchase assets that must be fixed (not movable) property, such as a house or piece of farm land. The assets are registered as the legal property of the borrower but the lender can seize them and dispose of them if they are not satisfied with the manner in which the repayment of the loan is conducted by the borrower. Once the loan is fully repaid, the lender loses this right of seizure and the assets are then deemed to be unencumbered.
mortgage.example: We're renting a property in the city centre because we can't afford to get a mortgage yet.

mosquito.definition: A small flying insect of the family Culicidae, the females of which bite humans and animals and suck blood, leaving an itching bump on the skin, and sometimes carrying diseases like malaria and yellow fever.

moth.definition: A usually nocturnal insect of the order Lepidoptera, distinguished from butterflies by feather-like antennae.

mother.definition: A (human) female who has given birth to a baby
mother.example: He had something of his mother in him.

motor.definition: A machine or device that converts other energy forms into mechanical energy, or imparts motion.

motorcycle.definition: An open-seated motor vehicle with handlebars instead of a steering wheel, and having two (or sometimes three) wheels.

mountain.definition: An elevation of land of considerable dimensions rising more or less abruptly, forming a conspicuous figure in the landscape, usually having a small extent of surface at its summit.
mountain.example: We spent the weekend hiking in the mountains.

mountains.definition: An elevation of land of considerable dimensions rising more or less abruptly, forming a conspicuous figure in the landscape, usually having a small extent of surface at its summit.
mountains.example: We spent the weekend hiking in the mountains.

mouse.definition: Any small rodent of the genus Mus.

mouth.definition: The opening of a creature through which food is ingested.
mouth.example: "Open your mouth and say 'aah'," directed the doctor.

movie.definition: A recorded sequence of images displayed on a screen at a rate sufficiently fast to create the appearance of motion.

mud.definition: A mixture of water and soil or fine grained sediment.

muffin.definition: A type of flattish bun, usually cut in two horizontally, toasted and spread with butter, etc, before being eaten.

multiply.definition: An act or instance of multiplying.

mummy.definition: An embalmed human or animal corpse wrapped in linen bandages for burial, especially as practised by the ancient Egyptians and some Native American tribes.

muscle.definition: A contractile form of tissue which animals use to effect movement.
muscle.example: Muscle consists largely of actin and myosin filaments.

museum.definition: A building or institution dedicated to the acquisition, conservation, study, exhibition, and educational interpretation of objects having scientific, historical, cultural or artistic value.

mushroom.definition: Any of the fleshy fruiting bodies of fungi typically produced above ground on soil or on their food sources (such as decaying wood).
mushroom.example: Some mushrooms are edible and taste good, while others are poisonous and taste foul.

music.definition: A series of sounds organized in time, employing melody, harmony, tempo etc. usually to convey a mood.
music.example: I keep listening to this music because it's a masterpiece.

musician.definition: A composer, conductor, or performer of music; specifically, a person who sings and/or plays a musical instrument as a hobby, an occupation, or a profession.

mustard.definition: A plant of certain species of the genus Brassica, or of related genera (especially Sinapis alba, in the family Brassicaceae, with yellow flowers, and linear seed pods).

myth.definition: A traditional story which embodies a belief regarding some fact or phenomenon of experience, and in which often the forces of nature and of the soul are personified; a sacred narrative regarding a god, a hero, the origin of the world or of a people, etc.

nail.definition: The thin, horny plate at the ends of fingers and toes on humans and some other animals.
nail.example: When I'm nervous I bite my nails.

nap.definition: A short period of sleep, especially one during the day.

nature.definition: The natural world; that which consists of all things unaffected by or predating human technology, production, and design. (Compare ecosystem.)

neck.definition: The part of the body connecting the head and the trunk found in humans and some animals.

necklace.definition: An article of jewelry that is worn around the neck, most often made of a string of precious metal, pearls, gems, beads or shells, and sometimes having a pendant attached.

neighborhood.definition: The quality of being a neighbor, of living nearby, next to each-other; proximity.
neighborhood.example: Our neighborhood was our only reason to exchange hollow greetings.

nerve.definition: A bundle of neurons with their connective tissue sheaths, blood vessels and lymphatics.
nerve.example: The nerves can be seen through the skin.

network.definition: A fabric or structure of fibrous elements attached to each other at regular intervals.

neutron.definition: A subatomic particle forming part of the nucleus of an atom and having no charge; it is a combination of an up quark and two down quarks.

news.example: Is there any news about the storm?

newsletter.definition: A periodically sent publication containing current events or the like, generally on a particular topic or geared toward a limited audience.

newspaper.definition: A publication, usually published daily or weekly and usually printed on cheap, low-quality paper, containing news and other articles.

nickel.definition: A silvery elemental metal with an atomic number of 28 and symbol Ni.

night.definition: The period between sunset and sunrise, when a location faces far away from the sun, thus when the sky is dark.
night.example: How do you sleep at night when you attack your kids like that!?

nightmare.definition: A demon or monster, thought to plague people while they slept and cause a feeling of suffocation and terror during sleep.

noise.definition: Various sounds, usually unwanted or unpleasant.
noise.example: He knew that it was trash day, when the garbage collectors made all the noise.

noodles.definition: (usually in the plural) a string or strip of pasta
noodles.example: She slurped a long noodle up out of her soup.

north.definition: One of the four major compass points, specifically 0°, directed toward the North Pole, and conventionally upwards on a map, abbreviated as N.
north.example: Minnesota is in the north of the USA.

nose.definition: A protuberance on the face housing the nostrils, which are used to breathe or smell.
nose.example: She has a cold in the nose.

notebook.definition: A book in which notes or memoranda are written.

notepad.definition: A pad of paper, often bound, in which one jots down notes; a notebook.

novel.definition: Newly made, formed or evolved; having no precedent; of recent origin; new.

nugget.definition: A small, compact chunk or clump.

number.definition: An abstract entity used to describe quantity.
number.example: Zero, one, −1, 2.5, and pi are all numbers.

nun.definition: A member of a Christian religious community of women who live by certain vows and usually wear a habit, (specifically) those living together in a cloister.

nylon.definition: Originally, the DuPont company trade name for polyamide, a copolymer whose molecules consist of alternating diamine and dicarboxylic acid monomers bonded together; now generically used for this type of polymer.

oar.definition: A type of lever used to propel a boat, having a flat blade at one end and a handle at the other, and pivoted in a rowlock atop the gunwale, whereby a rower seated in the boat and pulling the handle can pass the blade through the water by repeated strokes against the water's resistance, thus moving the boat .

oasis.definition: A spring of fresh water, surrounded by a fertile region of vegetation, in a desert.

observatory.definition: A place where stars, planets and other celestial bodies are observed, usually through a telescope; also place for observing meteorological or other natural phenomena.

ocean.definition: One of the large bodies of water separating the continents.

office.definition: A ceremonial duty or service, particularly:

officer.definition: One who has a position of authority in a hierarchical organization, especially in military, police or government organizations.

onion.definition: A monocotyledonous plant (Allium cepa), allied to garlic, used as vegetable and spice.

opinion.definition: A subjective belief, judgment or perspective that a person has formed about a topic, issue, person or thing.
opinion.example: Every man is a fool in some man's opinion.

orange.definition: An evergreen tree of the genus Citrus such as Citrus sinensis.

orbit.definition: A circular or elliptical path of one object around another object, particularly in astronomy and space travel.
orbit.example: The Moon's orbit around the Earth takes nearly one month to complete.

ornament.definition: An element of decoration; that which embellishes or adorns.

orphan.definition: A person, especially a minor, both or (rarely) one of whose parents have died.

ostrich.definition: A large flightless bird (Struthio camelus) native to Africa.

ounce.definition: An avoirdupois ounce, weighing 1/16 of an avoirdupois pound, or 28.3495 grams.

outcome.definition: That which is produced or occurs as a result of an event or process.
outcome.example: A quality automobile is the outcome of the work of skilled engineers and thousands of workers.

outlet.definition: A vent or similar passage to allow the escape of something.

outside.definition: The part of something that faces out; the outer surface.
outside.example: He's repainting the outside of his house.

oval.definition: An elongated round shape resembling an egg or ellipse.

oven.definition: A chamber used for baking or heating.

overflow.definition: The spillage resultant from overflow; excess.

overture.definition: An opening; a recess or chamber.

owl.definition: Any of various birds of prey of the order Strigiformes that are primarily nocturnal and have forward-looking, binocular vision, limited eye movement, and good hearing.

owner.example: The police recovered the stolen car and returned it to its owner.

pacemaker.definition: One who sets the pace in a race, to guide the others.

pack.definition: A bundle made up and prepared to be carried; especially, a bundle to be carried on the back, but also a load for an animal, a bale.
pack.example: The horses carried the packs across the plain.

package.definition: Something which is packed, a parcel, a box, an envelope.

pad.definition: A flattened mass of anything soft, to sit or lie on.

paddle.definition: A two-handed, single-bladed oar used to propel a canoe or a small boat.

page.definition: One of the many pieces of paper bound together within a book or similar document.

pail.definition: A vessel of wood, tin, plastic, etc., usually cylindrical and having a handle -- used especially for carrying liquids, for example water or milk; a bucket (sometimes with a cover).
pail.example: The milkmaid carried a pail of milk in each hand.

pain.definition: An ache or bodily suffering, or an instance of this; an unpleasant sensation, resulting from a derangement of functions, disease, or injury by violence; hurt.
pain.example: I had to stop running when I started getting pains in my feet.

pajamas.definition: Clothes for wearing to bed and sleeping in, usually consisting of a loose-fitting shirt and pants/trousers.

palace.definition: Official residence of a head of state or other dignitary, especially in a monarchical or imperial governmental system.

palm.definition: Any of various evergreen trees from the family Palmae or Arecaceae, which are mainly found in the tropics.

pan.definition: A wide, flat receptacle used around the house, especially for cooking.

pancake.definition: A thin batter cake fried in a pan or on a griddle in oil or butter.

panda.definition: The red panda (Ailurus fulgens), a small raccoon-like animal of northeast Asia with reddish fur and a long, ringed tail.

panic.definition: Overpowering fright, often affecting groups of people or animals.

panther.definition: Any of various big cats with black fur; most especially, the black-coated leopard of India.

pantry.definition: A small room, closet, or cabinet usually located in or near the kitchen, dedicated to shelf-stable food storage and/or storing kitchenware, like a larder, but smaller.

pants.definition: (Manchester) An outer garment that covers the body from the waist downwards, covering each leg separately, usually as far as the ankles; trousers.

paper.definition: A sheet material used for writing on or printing on (or as a non-waterproof container), usually made by draining cellulose fibres from a suspension in water.

parade.definition: An organized procession consisting of a series of consecutive displays, performances, exhibits, etc. displayed by moving down a street past a crowd of spectators.
parade.example: The floats and horses in the parade were impressive, but the marching bands were really amazing.

parents.definition: One of the two persons from whom one is immediately biologically descended; a mother or father.

park.definition: An area of land set aside for environment preservation or recreation.

parka.definition: A long jacket with a hood which protects the wearer against rain and wind.

parody.definition: A work or performance that imitates another work or performance with ridicule or irony.

parrot.definition: A kind of bird, many species of which are colourful and able to mimic human speech, of the order Psittaciformes or (narrowly) of the family Psittacidae.
parrot.example: I bought a wonderful parrot at the pet store.

partner.definition: Someone who is associated with another in a common activity or interest.

party.definition: A person or group of people constituting a particular side in a contract or legal action.
party.example: The contract requires that the party of the first part pay the fee.

passage.definition: A paragraph or section of text or music with particular meaning.
passage.example: She struggled to play the difficult passages.

passenger.definition: One who rides or travels in a vehicle, but who does not operate it and is not a member of the crew.
passenger.example: Somebody in a team who does not do their fair share of the work.

passion.definition: Any great, strong, powerful emotion, especially romantic love or extreme hate.
passion.example: We share a passion for books.

passport.definition: An official document normally used for international journeys, which proves the identity and nationality of the person for whom it was issued.
passport.example: You will have to bring your passport to prove who you are.

password.definition: A word used to gain admittance or to gain access to information; watchword.

pasta.definition: Dough made from wheat and water and sometimes mixed with egg and formed into various shapes; often sold in dried form and typically boiled for eating.

pastry.definition: A baked food item made from flour and fat pastes such as pie crust; also tarts, bear claws, napoleons, puff pastries, etc.
pastry.example: That pastry shop sells not just pastries, but all kinds of baked goods.

path.definition: A trail for the use of, or worn by, pedestrians.

patient.definition: A person or animal who receives treatment from a doctor or other medically educated person.

patrol.definition: A going of the rounds along the chain of sentinels and between the posts, by a guard, usually consisting of three or four men, to insure greater security from attacks on the outposts.

pause.definition: A button whose functions are pausing and resuming something, such as a DVD player, a video game or a computer.

pay.definition: Money given in return for work; salary or wages.
pay.example: Many employers have rules designed to keep employees from comparing their pays.

pea.definition: A plant, Pisum sativum, member of the legume (Fabaceae) family.

peace.definition: A state of tranquility, quiet, and harmony; absence of violence. For instance, a state free from civil disturbance.
peace.example: Our lounge strives to maintain an environment of peace for the comfort of our customers.

peach.definition: A tree (Prunus persica), native to China and now widely cultivated throughout temperate regions, having pink flowers and edible fruit.

peacock.definition: A male peafowl, especially Pavo cristatus, notable for its brilliant iridescently ocellated tail.

peak.definition: A point; the sharp end or top of anything that terminates in a point; as, the peak, or front, of a cap.

peanut.definition: A legume resembling a nut, the fruit of the plant Arachis hypogaea.

pearl.definition: A shelly concretion, usually rounded, and having a brilliant luster, with varying tints, found in the mantle, or between the mantle and shell, of certain bivalve mollusks, especially in the pearl oysters and river mussels, and sometimes in certain univalves. It is usually due to a secretion of shelly substance around some irritating foreign particle. Its substance is the same as nacre, or mother-of-pearl. Round lustrous pearls are used in jewellery.

peasant.definition: A member of the lowly social class that toils on the land, constituted by small farmers and tenants, sharecroppers, farmhands and other laborers on the land where they form the main labor force in agriculture and horticulture.

pedestal.definition: The base or foot of a column, statue, vase, lamp.

peel.definition: (usually uncountable) The skin or outer layer of a fruit, vegetable, etc.

pelican.definition: Any of various seabirds of the family Pelecanidae, having a long bill with a distendable pouch.

pen.definition: An enclosure (enclosed area) used to contain domesticated animals, especially sheep or cattle.
pen.example: There are two steers in the third pen.

penalty.example: The penalty for his crime was to do hard labor.

penguin.definition: Any of several flightless sea birds, of order Sphenisciformes, found in the Southern Hemisphere, marked by their usual upright stance, walking on short legs, and (generally) their stark black and white plumage.
