penny.definition: In the United Kingdom and Ireland, a copper coin worth 1/240 of a pound sterling or Irish pound before decimalisation. Abbreviation: d.

pension.definition: An annuity paid regularly as benefit due to a retired employee, serviceman etc. in consideration of past services, originally and chiefly by a government but also by various private pension schemes.
pension.example: Many old people depend on their pension to pay the bills.

pentagon.definition: A polygon with five sides and five angles.

people.definition: Used as plural of person; a body of human beings considered generally or collectively; a group of two or more persons.
people.example: There were so many people at the restaurant last night.

pepper.definition: A plant of the family Piperaceae.

percentage.definition: The amount, number or rate of something, regarded as part of a total of 100; a part of a whole.
percentage.example: A high percentage of secondary school leavers take a gap year.

perfume.definition: A pleasant smell; the scent, odor, or odoriferous particles emitted from a sweet-smelling substance; a pleasant odor

period.example: There was a period of confusion following the announcement.

person.definition: An individual; usually a human being.
person.example: Each person is unique, both mentally and physically.

pharmacy.definition: (countable) A place where prescription drugs are dispensed; a dispensary.

phone.definition: A device for transmitting conversations and other sounds in real time across distances, now often a small portable unit also capable of running software etc.

photograph.definition: A picture created by projecting an image onto a photosensitive surface such as a chemically treated plate or film, CCD receptor, etc.

physician.definition: A practitioner of physic, i.e. a specialist in internal medicine, especially as opposed to a surgeon; a practitioner who treats with medication rather than with surgery.

physics.definition: A medicine or drug, especially a cathartic or purgative.

piano.definition: A percussive keyboard musical instrument, usually ranging over seven octaves, with white and black colored keys, played by pressing these keys, causing hammers to strike strings
piano.example: He can play "Happy Birthday" on the piano.

pickle.definition: A cucumber preserved in a solution, usually a brine or a vinegar syrup.
pickle.example: A pickle goes well with a hamburger.

picnic.definition: An informal social gathering, usually in a natural outdoor setting, to which the participants bring their own food and drink.
picnic.example: We went out for a picnic in the forest.

picture.definition: A representation of anything (as a person, a landscape, a building) upon canvas, paper, or other surface, by drawing, painting, printing, photography, etc.

pie.definition: A type of pastry that consists of an outer crust and a filling.
pie.example: The family had steak and kidney pie for dinner and cherry pie for dessert.

piece.definition: A part of a larger whole, usually in such a form that it is able to be separated from other parts.
piece.example: I’d like another piece of pie.

pig.definition: Any of several intelligent mammalian species of the genus Sus, having cloven hooves, bristles and a nose adapted for digging; especially the domesticated animal Sus scrofa.
pig.example: The man kept a pen with two pigs that he fed from carrots to cabbage.

pigeon.definition: One of several birds of the family Columbidae, which consists of more than 300 species.

pigpen.definition: A pigsty; an enclosure where pigs are kept.

pilgrim.definition: One who travels, especially on a journey to visit sites of religious significance.

pillow.definition: A soft cushion used to support the head in bed.

pillowcase.definition: A washable, easily removable cloth cover for pillows.

pilot.definition: A person who steers a ship, a helmsman.

pin.definition: A needle without an eye (usually) made of drawn-out steel wire with one end sharpened and the other flattened or rounded into a head, used for fastening.

pine.definition: Any coniferous tree of the genus Pinus.
pine.example: The northern slopes were covered mainly in pine.

pineapple.definition: A tropical plant, Ananas comosus, native to South America, having thirty or more long, spined and pointed leaves surrounding a thick stem.

pinecone.definition: The seed-bearing conical fruit of a pine tree.

pinky.definition: Methylated spirits mixed with red wine or Condy's crystals.

pinwheel.definition: An artificial flower with a stem, usually plastic, for children: the flower spins round in the wind, like a small paper windmill.

pipe.definition: Meanings relating to a wind instrument.

pirate.definition: A criminal who plunders at sea; commonly attacking merchant vessels, though often pillaging port towns.
pirate.example: You should be cautious due to the Somali pirates.

pitcher.definition: One who pitches anything, as hay, quoits, a ball, etc.

pizza.definition: A baked Italian dish of a thinly rolled bread dough crust typically topped before baking with tomato sauce, cheese and other ingredients such as meat, vegetables or fruit
pizza.example: Want to go out for pizza tonight?

plank.definition: A long, broad and thick piece of timber, as opposed to a board which is less thick.

plant.definition: An organism that is not an animal, especially an organism capable of photosynthesis. Typically a small or herbaceous organism of this kind, rather than a tree.
plant.example: The garden had a couple of trees, and a cluster of colourful plants around the border.

plantation.definition: A large farm; estate or area of land designated for agricultural growth. Often includes housing for the owner and workers.

plaster.definition: A paste applied to the skin for healing or cosmetic purposes.

plastic.definition: A synthetic, solid, hydrocarbon-based polymer, whether thermoplastic or thermosetting.

plate.definition: A slightly curved but almost flat dish from which food is served or eaten.
plate.example: I filled my plate from the bountiful table.

platform.definition: A raised stage from which speeches are made and on which musical and other performances are made.

platypus.definition: A semi-aquatic, egg-laying monotreme mammal with a bill resembling that of a duck, that has a mole-like body, a tail resembling that of a beaver, a waterproof pelt, and flat webbed feet — males have poisonous spurs on the inside of the back legs; Ornithorhynchus anatinus

playground.definition: (outdoors) A large open space for children to play on, usually having dedicated play equipment (such as swings and slides).

pleasure.definition: A state of being pleased or contented; gratification.
pleasure.example: He remembered with pleasure his home and family.

plow.definition: The notional area of land able to be farmed in a year by a team of 8 oxen pulling a carruca plow, usually reckoned at 120 acres.

pocket.definition: A bag stitched to an item of clothing, used for carrying small items.

pocketwatch.definition: A watch carried in the pocket, often with a closing cover and usually attached to a chain.

poem.definition: A literary piece written in verse.

poetry.definition: Literature composed in verse or language exhibiting conscious attention to patterns and rhythm.

police.definition: A civil force granted the legal authority for law enforcement and maintaining public order.

polish.example: A good silver polish will remove tarnish easily.

politics.definition: To engage in political activity; politick.

pollution.definition: The desecration of something holy or sacred; defilement, profanation.

polo.definition: A ball game where two teams of players on horseback use long-handled mallets to propel the ball along the ground and into their opponent's goal.

poodle.definition: A breed of dog originating in Europe as hunting dogs, and having heavy, curly coat in a solid color; their shoulder height indicates their classification as standard, medium, miniature, or toy.

pool.definition: A small and rather deep collection of (usually) fresh water, as one supplied by a spring, or occurring in the course of a stream; a reservoir for water.

pop.definition: A loud, sharp sound as of a cork coming out of a bottle.
pop.example: Listen to the pop of a champagne cork.

popcorn.definition: A snack food made from corn/maize kernels popped by dry heating.

popsicle.definition: Frozen fruit juice, flavored sugar water or the like, on a stick, of a size to be one serving.

porch.definition: A covered and enclosed entrance to a building, whether taken from the interior, and forming a sort of vestibule within the main wall, or projecting without and with a separate roof.

porcupine.definition: Any of several rodents of either of the taxonomic families Hystricidae (Old World porcupines) or Erethizontidae (New World porcupines), both from the infraorder Hystricognathi, noted for their sharp spines or quills, which are raised when the animal is attacked or surprised.

post.definition: A long dowel or plank protruding from the ground; a fencepost; a lightpost.
post.example: ram a post into the ground

postcard.definition: A rectangular piece of thick paper or thin cardboard intended to be written on and mailed without an envelope. In the case of a picture postcard one side carries a picture or photograph.

pot.definition: A flat-bottomed vessel (usually metal) used for cooking food.

potato.definition: The tuber of a plant, Solanum tuberosum, eaten as a starchy vegetable, particularly in the Americas and Europe; this plant.

potter.definition: One who makes pots and other ceramic wares.

pouch.definition: A small bag usually closed with a drawstring.

pound.definition: A unit of mass equal to 16 avoirdupois ounces (= 453.592 37 g). Today this value is the most common meaning of "pound" as a unit of weight.

powder.definition: The fine particles which are the result of reducing dry substance by pounding, grinding, or triturating, or the result of decay; dust.

power.definition: Ability to do or undergo something.

practice.definition: Repetition of an activity to improve a skill.
practice.example: He will need lots of practice with the lines before he performs them.

pray.definition: To direct words and/or thoughts to God or any higher being, for the sake of adoration, thanks, petition for help, etc.
pray.example: Muslims pray in the direction of Mecca.

presence.definition: The fact or condition of being present, or of being within sight or call, or at hand.
presence.example: Any painter can benefit from the presence of a live model from which to draw.

present.definition: The current moment or period of time.

president.definition: An act in the past which may be used as an example to help decide the outcome of similar instances in the future.

pressure.definition: A pressing; a force applied to a surface.
pressure.example: Apply pressure to the wound to stop the bleeding.

pretzel.definition: A toasted bread or cracker usually in the shape of a loose knot.

price.definition: The cost required to gain possession of something.

pride.definition: The quality or state of being proud; an unreasonable overestimation of one's own superiority in terms of talents, looks, wealth, importance etc., which manifests itself in lofty airs, distance, reserve and often contempt of others.

priest.definition: A religious clergyman (clergywoman, clergyperson) who is trained to perform services or sacrifices at a church or temple
priest.example: The Israelite priests were descended from Moses' brother Aaron.

prince.definition: A (male) ruler, a sovereign; a king, monarch.

prize.definition: That which is taken from another; something captured; a thing seized by force, stratagem, or superior power.

pro.definition: An advantage of something, especially when contrasted with its disadvantages (cons).
pro.example: What are the pros and cons of buying a car?

problem.definition: A difficulty that has to be resolved or dealt with.
problem.example: She's leaving because she faced numerous problems to do with racism.

product.example: That store offers a variety of products.  We've got to sell a lot of product by the end of the month.

professor.definition: The most senior rank for an academic at a university or similar institution, informally also known as "full professor." Abbreviated Prof.

profile.definition: The outermost shape, view, or edge of an object.
profile.example: His fingers traced the profile of the handle.

profit.definition: Total income or cash flow minus expenditures. The money or other benefit a non-governmental organization or individual receives in exchange for products and services sold at an advertised price.

program.example: Our program for today’s exercise class includes swimming and jogging.

project.definition: A planned endeavor, usually with a specific goal and accomplished in several steps or stages.

promise.definition: An oath or affirmation; a vow
promise.example: if I make a promise, I always stick to it;  he broke his promise

proof.definition: An effort, process, or operation designed to establish or discover a fact or truth; an act of testing; a test; a trial.

proposal.definition: Something which is proposed, or offered for consideration or acceptance

psychiatrist.definition: A medical doctor specializing in psychiatry.

pull.example: He gave the hair a sharp pull and it came out.

pumpkin.definition: A domesticated plant, in species Cucurbita pepo, similar in growth pattern, foliage, flower, and fruit to the squash or melon.

punk.definition: A person used for sex, particularly:

puppet.definition: Any small model of a person or animal able to be moved by strings or rods, or in the form of a glove.

purple.definition: A colour/color that is a dark blend of red and blue; dark magenta.

purse.definition: A small bag for carrying money.

pyramid.definition: An ancient massive construction with a square or rectangular base and four triangular sides meeting in an apex, such as those built as tombs in Egypt or as bases for temples in Mesoamerica.

quack.definition: The sound made by a duck.
quack.example: Did you hear that duck make a quack?

quarantine.definition: The desert in which Christ fasted for 40 days according to the Bible.

queen.definition: A female monarch. Example: Queen Victoria.

quesadilla.definition: A Mexican dish made by filling a tortilla (corn or flour) with cheese, folding in half and toasting until the cheese is melted. Additional ingredients, such as meats (chicken or beef, commonly), or vegetables can be added. Often served with salsa, guacamole and/or sour cream.

quicksand.definition: Wet sand that things readily sink in, often found near rivers or coasts
quicksand.example: My feet were firmly lodged in the quicksand, and the more I struggled the more I sank into it.

quilt.definition: A bed covering consisting of two layers of fabric stitched together, with insulation between, often having a decorative design.
quilt.example: My grandmother is going to sew a quilt.

rabbit.definition: A mammal of the family Leporidae, with long ears, long hind legs and a short, fluffy tail.
rabbit.example: The pioneers survived by eating the small game they could get: rabbits, squirrels and occasionally a raccoon.

race.definition: A contest between people, animals, vehicles, etc. where the goal is to be the first to reach some objective. Example: Several horses run in a horse race, and the first one to reach the finishing post wins
race.example: The race around the park was won by Johnny, who ran faster than the others.

radio.definition: The technology that allows for the transmission of sound or other signals by modulation of electromagnetic waves.

radish.definition: A plant of the Brassicaceae family, Raphanus sativus or Raphanus raphanistrum subsp. sativus, having an edible root.

raft.definition: A flat-bottomed craft able to float and drift on water, used for transport or as a waterborne platform.
raft.example: An inflatable raft. A log raft.

rail.definition: A horizontal bar extending between supports and used for support or as a barrier; a railing.

railroad.definition: A permanent road consisting of fixed metal rails to drive trains or similar motorized vehicles on.
railroad.example: Many railroads roughly follow the trace of older land - and/or water roads

rain.definition: Condensed water falling from a cloud.
rain.example: The rains came late that year.

rainbow.definition: A multicoloured arch in the sky, produced by prismatic refraction of light within droplets of rain in the air.

raindrop.definition: A single droplet of rainwater that has just fallen or is falling from the sky.

raise.definition: An increase in wages or salary; a rise (UK).
raise.example: The boss gave me a raise.

rake.definition: A garden tool with a row of pointed teeth fixed to a long handle, used for collecting debris, grass, etc., for flattening the ground, or for loosening soil; also, a similar wheel-mounted tool drawn by a horse or a tractor.

ramen.definition: Soup noodles of wheat, with various ingredients (Japanese style)

ranch.definition: A large plot of land used for raising cattle, sheep or other livestock.

range.definition: A line or series of mountains, buildings, etc.

rat.definition: A medium-sized rodent belonging to the genus Rattus.

ratchet.definition: A pawl, click or detent for holding or propelling a ratchet wheel, or ratch, etc.

rating.definition: To assign or be assigned a particular rank or level.
rating.example: She is rated fourth in the country.

ratio.definition: A number representing a comparison between two named things.

rattlesnake.definition: Any of various venomous American snakes, of genera Crotalus and Sistrurus, having a rattle at the end of its tail.

razor.definition: A keen-edged knife of peculiar shape, used in shaving the hair from the face or other parts of the body.

reaction.definition: An action or statement in response to a stimulus or other event.
reaction.example: The announcement of the verdict brought a violent reaction.

read.definition: A reading or an act of reading, especially an actor's part of a play.

receipt.definition: The act of receiving, or the fact of having been received.
receipt.example: A balance payable on receipt of the goods.

recess.example: Spring recess offers a good chance to travel.

recipe.definition: A formula for preparing or using a medicine; a prescription; also, a medicine prepared from such instructions.

record.definition: A disk, usually made of a polymer, used to record sound for playback on a phonograph.

red.definition: Any of a range of colours having the longest wavelengths, 670 nm, of the visible spectrum; a primary additive colour for transmitted light: the colour obtained by subtracting green and blue from white light using magenta and yellow filters; the colour of blood, ripe strawberries, etc.

reflection.definition: The act of reflecting or the state of being reflected.

refrigerator.definition: A household appliance used for keeping food fresh by refrigeration (short form fridge).

region.definition: Any considerable and connected part of a space or surface; specifically, a tract of land or sea of considerable but indefinite extent; a country; a district; in a broad sense, a place without special reference to location or extent but viewed as an entity for geographical, social or cultural reasons.

register.definition: A machine that tabulates the amount of sales transactions, makes a permanent and cumulative record of them, and has a drawer in which cash can be kept.

reindeer.definition: (plural: reindeer) Any Arctic and subarctic-dwelling deer of the species Rangifer tarandus, with a number of subspecies.

relative.definition: Someone in the same family; someone connected by blood, marriage, or adoption.
relative.example: Why do my relatives always talk about sex?

relief.definition: The removal of stress or discomfort.
relief.example: I sighed with relief when I found out that my daughter hadn't got lost, but was waiting for me at home.

remote.definition: An element of broadcast programming originating away from the station's or show's control room.

rent.definition: A payment made by a tenant at intervals in order to occupy a property.

republic.definition: A state where sovereignty rests with the people or their representatives, rather than with a monarch or emperor; a country with no monarchy.
republic.example: The United States is a republic; the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland is a constitutional monarchy.

research.definition: Diligent inquiry or examination to seek or revise facts, principles, theories, applications, etc.; laborious or continued search after truth.
research.example: The research station that houses Wang and his team is outside Lijiang, a city of about 1.2 million people.

resident.definition: A person, animal or plant living at a certain location or in a certain area.
resident.example: The tiger lily is a resident of Asia.

resort.definition: A place where people go for recreation, especially one with facilities such as lodgings, entertainment, and a relaxing environment.

response.definition: An answer or reply, or something in the nature of an answer or reply.

restaurant.definition: An eating establishment in which diners are served food, usually by waiters at their tables but sometimes (as in a fast food restaurant) at a counter.

retail.definition: The sale of goods directly to the consumer, encompassing the storefronts, mail-order, websites, etc., and the corporate mechanisms, branding, advertising, etc. that support them.

retire.definition: The act of retiring, or the state of being retired.

revenue.definition: The income returned by an investment.

review.definition: A second or subsequent reading of a text or artifact in an attempt to gain new insights.
review.example: I need to make a review of the book before I can understand it.

revolution.definition: A political upheaval in a government or nation state characterized by great change.

reward.definition: Something of value given in return for an act.
reward.example: For catching the thief, you'll get a nice reward.

rhinoceros.definition: Any of several large herbivorous pachyderms native to Africa and Asia of the five extant species in the three extant genera in the family Rhinocerotidae, with thick, gray skin and one or two horns on their snouts.

rhyme.example: Many editors say they don't want stories written in rhyme.

rhythm.definition: The variation of strong and weak elements (such as duration, accent) of sounds, notably in speech or music, over time; a beat or meter.
rhythm.example: Dance to the rhythm of the music.

ribs.definition: Any of a series of long curved bones occurring in 12 pairs in humans and other animals and extending from the spine to or toward the sternum

rice.definition: Cereal plants, Oryza sativa of the grass family whose seeds are used as food.

riddle.definition: A verbal puzzle, mystery, or other problem of an intellectual nature.
riddle.example: Here's a riddle: It's black, and white, and red all over. What is it?

rifle.definition: A shouldered firearm with a long, rifled barrel to improve range and accuracy.

rim.definition: An edge around something, especially when circular.

ring.definition: (physical) A solid object in the shape of a circle.

ringleader.definition: A leader of a group of people, especially an unofficial group.

risk.definition: A possible adverse event or outcome

ritual.definition: Rite; a repeated set of actions
ritual.example: They carried out the ritual carefully.

river.definition: A large and often winding stream which drains a land mass, carrying water down from higher areas to a lower point, oftentimes ending in another body of water, such as an ocean or in an inland sea.
river.example: Occasionally rivers overflow their banks and cause floods.

roach.definition: Certain members of the fish family Cyprinidae, including:

road.definition: A way used for travelling between places, originally one wide enough to allow foot passengers and horses to travel, now (US) usually one surfaced with asphalt or concrete and designed to accommodate many vehicles travelling in both directions. In the UK both senses are heard: a country road is the same as a country lane.

robot.definition: A machine built to carry out some complex task or group of tasks by physically moving, especially one which can be programmed.

rodeo.definition: A gathering of cattle to be branded.

role.definition: A character or part played by a performer or actor.
role.example: Her dream was to get a role in a Hollywood movie, no matter how small.

roll.definition: The act or result of rolling, or state of being rolled.
roll.example: Look at the roll of the waves.

roof.definition: The external covering at the top of a building.
roof.example: The roof was blown off by the tornado.

root.definition: The part of a plant, generally underground, that anchors and supports the plant body, absorbs and stores water and nutrients, and in some plants is able to perform vegetative reproduction.
root.example: This tree's roots can go as deep as twenty metres underground.

rope.definition: Thick strings, yarn, monofilaments, metal wires, or strands of other cordage that are twisted together to form a stronger line.
rope.example: Nylon rope is usually stronger than similar rope made of plant fibers.

rose.definition: A shrub of the genus Rosa, with red, pink, white or yellow flowers.

round.definition: So as to form a circle or trace a circular path, or approximation thereof.

row.definition: A line of objects, often regularly spaced, such as seats in a theatre, vegetable plants in a garden etc.

rubber.definition: Pliable material derived from the sap of the rubber tree; a hydrocarbon polymer of isoprene.

ruby.definition: A clear, deep, red variety of corundum, valued as a precious stone.

rug.definition: A partial covering for a floor.

ruin.definition: (sometimes in the plural) The remains of a destroyed or dilapidated construction, such as a house or castle.

rule.example: All participants must adhere to the rules.

runoff.definition: That portion of precipitation or irrigation on an area which does not infiltrate or evaporate, but instead is discharged from the area.

rust.definition: The deteriorated state of iron or steel as a result of moisture and oxidation.
rust.example: The rust on my bicycle chain made cycling to work very dangerous.

rut.definition: Sexual desire or oestrus of cattle, and various other mammals.

sack.definition: A bag; especially a large bag of strong, coarse material for storage and handling of various commodities, such as potatoes, coal, coffee; or, a bag with handles used at a supermarket, a grocery sack; or, a small bag for small items, a satchel.

sad.definition: To make melancholy; to sadden or grieve (someone).

saddle.definition: A seat (tack) for a rider placed on the back of a horse or other animal.

safe.definition: A box, usually made of metal, in which valuables can be locked for safekeeping.

safety.definition: The condition or feeling of being safe; security; certainty.
safety.example: If you push it to the limit, safety is not guaranteed.

sail.definition: A piece of fabric attached to a boat and arranged such that it causes the wind to drive the boat along. The sail may be attached to the boat via a combination of mast, spars and ropes.

sailboat.definition: A boat propelled by a sail.

salad.definition: A food made primarily of a mixture of raw or cold ingredients, typically vegetables, usually served with a dressing such as vinegar or mayonnaise.

salary.definition: A fixed amount of money paid to a worker, usually calculated on a monthly or annual basis, not hourly, as wages. Implies a degree of professionalism and/or autonomy.

salmon.definition: One of several species of fish, typically of the Salmoninae subfamily, brownish above with silvery sides and delicate pinkish-orange flesh; they ascend rivers to spawn.

saloon.definition: A large room, especially one used to receive and entertain guests.

salsa.definition: A spicy tomato sauce, often including onions and hot peppers.

salt.definition: A common substance, chemically consisting mainly of sodium chloride (NaCl), used extensively as a condiment and preservative.

sample.definition: A part or snippet of something taken or presented for inspection, or shown as evidence of the quality of the whole; a specimen.

sand.definition: Rock that is ground more finely than gravel, but is not as fine as silt (more formally, see grain sizes chart), forming beaches and deserts and also used in construction.

sandals.definition: A type of open shoe made up of straps or bands holding a sole to the foot

sandbox.definition: A children's play area consisting of a box filled with sand.

sandwich.definition: A dish or foodstuff where two or more slices of bread serve as the wrapper or container of some other food.

sash.definition: A piece of cloth designed to be worn around the waist.

sauce.definition: A liquid (often thickened) condiment or accompaniment to food.

saucer.definition: A small shallow dish to hold a cup and catch drips.

saw.definition: A tool with a toothed blade used for cutting hard substances, in particular wood or metal

saxophone.definition: A single-reed instrument musical instrument of the woodwind family, usually made of brass and with a distinctive loop bringing the bell upwards.

scale.definition: A ladder; a series of steps; a means of ascending.

scapegoat.definition: In the Mosaic Day of Atonement ritual, a goat symbolically imbued with the sins of the people, and sent out alive into the wilderness while another was sacrificed.

scarecrow.definition: An effigy, typically made of straw and dressed in old clothes, fixed to a pole in a field to deter birds from eating seeds or crops planted there.

schedule.definition: A slip of paper; a short note.

scheme.definition: A systematic plan of future action.

school.definition: (collective) A group of fish or a group of marine mammals such as porpoises, dolphins, or whales.
school.example: The divers encountered a huge school of mackerel.

science.definition: A particular discipline or branch of learning, especially one dealing with measurable or systematic principles rather than intuition or natural ability.
science.example: Of course in my opinion Social Studies is more of a science than an art.

scissors.definition: One blade on a pair of scissors.

score.definition: The total number of goals, points, runs, etc. earned by a participant in a game.
score.example: The player with the highest score is the winner.

scramble.definition: A rush or hurry, especially making use of the limbs against a surface.
scramble.example: a last-minute scramble to the finish line

scratch.definition: A disruption, mark or shallow cut on a surface made by scratching.
scratch.example: Her skin was covered with tiny scratches.

scream.definition: A loud, emphatic, exclamation of extreme emotion, especially horror, fear, excitement, or anger; it may comprise a word or a sustained, high-pitched vowel sound.

screen.definition: A physical divider intended to block an area from view, or provide shelter from something dangerous.

screw.definition: A device that has a helical function.

screwdriver.definition: A hand or machine tool which engages with the head of a screw and allows torque to be applied to turn the screw, thus driving it in or loosening it.

scroll.definition: A roll of paper or parchment; a writing formed into a roll.

scuba.definition: (underwater diving) An apparatus carried by a diver, which includes a tank holding compressed, filtered air and a regulator which delivers the air to the diver at ambient pressure which can be used underwater.

sea.definition: A large body of salt water.

seal.definition: A pinniped (Pinnipedia), particularly an earless seal (true seal) or eared seal.
seal.example: The seals in the harbor looked better than they smelled.

seashell.definition: The empty shell of a marine mollusk

season.definition: Each of the four divisions of a year: spring, summer, autumn (fall) and winter

second.definition: Something that is number two in a series.

secretary.definition: Someone entrusted with a secret; a confidant.

security.definition: The condition of not being threatened, especially physically, psychologically, emotionally, or financially.

seesaw.definition: A structure composed of a plank, balanced in the middle, used as a game in which one person goes up as the other goes down.

semester.definition: Half of a school year or academic year such as fall or spring semester.

senate.definition: In some bicameral legislative systems, the upper house or chamber.

send.definition: The rising motion of water as a wave passes; a surge; the upward angular displacement of a vessel, opposed to pitch, the correlative downward movement.

sentence.definition: The decision or judgement of a jury or court; a verdict.
sentence.example: The court returned a sentence of guilt in the first charge, but innocence in the second.

series.definition: A number of things that follow on one after the other or are connected one after the other.
series.example: A series of seemingly inconsequential events led cumulatively to the fall of the company.

session.definition: An informal gathering of musicians to play music, especially improvised jazz or a similar genre.

settler.definition: Someone who settles in a new location, especially one who takes up residence in a previously uninhabited place; a colonist.
settler.example: the first settlers of New England

seven.definition: The digit/figure 7 or an occurrence thereof.
seven.example: He wrote three sevens on the paper.

shadow.definition: A dark image projected onto a surface where light (or other radiation) is blocked by the shade of an object.
shadow.example: My shadow lengthened as the sun began to set.

shake.definition: The act of shaking or being shaken; tremulous or back-and-forth motion.
shake.example: She replied in the negative, with a shake of her head.

shampoo.definition: A traditional Indian and Persian body massage given after pouring warm water over the body and rubbing it with extracts from herbs.

shark.definition: A scaleless, predatory fish of the superorder Selachimorpha, with a cartilaginous skeleton and 5 to 7 gill slits on each side of its head.

shed.example: A metal comb shed her golden hair.

sheep.definition: A woolly ruminant of the genus Ovis.

sheepdog.definition: A breed of dog, used for herding sheep.

sheet.definition: A thin bed cloth used as a covering for a mattress or as a layer over the sleeper.
sheet.example: Use the sheets in the hall closet to make the bed.

shell.definition: A hard external covering of an animal.

shelter.definition: A refuge, haven or other cover or protection from something.

shield.definition: Anything that protects or defends; defense; shelter; protection.

ship.definition: A water-borne vessel generally larger than a boat.

shirt.definition: An article of clothing that is worn on the upper part of the body, and often has sleeves, either long or short, that cover the arms.
shirt.example: It can take a while to learn how to iron a shirt properly.

shock.example: The train hit the buffers with a great shock.

shoes.definition: A protective covering for the foot, with a bottom part composed of thick leather or plastic sole and often a thicker heel, and a softer upper part made of leather or synthetic material. Shoes generally do not extend above the ankle, as opposed to boots, which do.
shoes.example: Get your shoes on now, or you'll be late for school.

shoot.definition: The emerging stem and embryonic leaves of a new plant.

shop.definition: An establishment that sells goods or services to the public; originally only a physical location, but now a virtual establishment as well.

shoulder.definition: The part of an animal's body between the base of the neck and forearm socket.

shout.definition: A loud burst of voice or voices; a violent and sudden outcry, especially that of a multitude expressing joy, triumph, exultation, anger, or animated courage.

shovel.definition: A hand tool with a handle, used for moving portions of material such as earth, snow, and grain from one place to another, with some forms also used for digging. Not to be confused with a spade, which is designed solely for small-scale digging and incidental tasks such as chopping of small roots.

shower.definition: A brief fall of precipitation (spell of rain, or a similar fall of snow, sleet, or cascade).
shower.example: Today there will be frequent showers and some sunny spells.

shrew.definition: Any of numerous small, mouselike, chiefly nocturnal, mammals of the family Soricidae (order Soricomorpha).

shrimp.definition: Any of many swimming, often edible crustaceans, chiefly of the infraorder Caridea or the suborder Dendrobranchiata, with slender legs, long whiskers and a long abdomen.

side.definition: A bounding straight edge of a two-dimensional shape.

sidekick.definition: An assistant to another person, especially to a superior or more important person.

sidewalk.definition: A footpath, usually paved, at the side of a road for the use of pedestrians; a pavement (UK) or footpath (Australia, New Zealand)

sign.definition: (sometimes also used uncountably) A visible indication.
sign.example: I gave them a thumbs-up sign.

signal.definition: A sequence of states representing an encoded message in a communication channel.

signature.definition: A person's name, written by that person, used as identification or to signify approval of accompanying material, such as a legal contract.

silk.definition: A fine fiber excreted by the silkworm or other arthropod (such as a spider).
silk.example: The thread made of silk was barely visible.

silver.definition: A lustrous, white, metallic element, atomic number 47, atomic weight 107.87, symbol Ag.

sing.definition: A gathering at which people sing songs.

singer.definition: A person who sings, often professionally.

sink.definition: A basin used for holding water for washing.

sir.definition: A man of a higher rank or position.

sister.definition: A daughter of the same parents as another person; a female sibling.
sister.example: My sister is always driving me crazy.

skate.definition: A light boot, fitted with a blade, used for ice skating.

skateboard.definition: A narrow, wooden or plastic platform mounted on pairs of wheels, on which one stands and propels oneself by pushing along the ground with one foot.

ski.definition: One of a pair of long flat runners designed for gliding over snow or water

skill.definition: Capacity to do something well; technique, ability. Skills are usually acquired or learned, as opposed to abilities, which are often thought of as innate.

skin.definition: The outer protective layer of the body of any animal, including of a human.
skin.example: He is so disgusting he makes my skin crawl.

skip.definition: A leaping, jumping or skipping movement.

skirt.definition: An article of clothing, usually worn by women and girls, that hangs from the waist and covers the lower part of the body.

skull.definition: The main bones of the head considered as a unit; including the cranium, facial bones, and mandible.

skunk.definition: Any of various small mammals, of the family Mephitidae, native to North and Central America, having a glossy black with a white coat and two musk glands at the base of the tail for emitting a noxious smell as a defensive measure.

sky.definition: The atmosphere above a given point, especially as visible from the ground during the day.
sky.example: That year, a meteor fell from the sky.

skylight.definition: A window, dome, or opening in the roof or ceiling, to admit natural light.

skyscraper.definition: A very tall building with a large number of floors.

slap.definition: A blow, especially one given with the open hand, or with something broad and flat.

slate.definition: A fine-grained homogeneous sedimentary rock composed of clay or volcanic ash which has been metamorphosed so that it cleaves easily into thin layers.

sled.definition: A small, light vehicle with runners, used recreationally, mostly by children, for sliding down snow-covered hills. (A "sled" in this sense is not pulled by an animal as a "sleigh" is.)
sled.example: The child zoomed down the hill on his sled.

sleep.definition: To rest in a state of reduced consciousness.
sleep.example: You should sleep 8 hours a day.

sleepover.definition: The act of spending the night as a guest in another's house, especially when the participants are children.

sleeve.definition: The part of a garment that covers the arm.

slice.definition: That which is thin and broad.

slide.definition: An item of play equipment that children can climb up and then slide down again.
slide.example: The long, red slide was great fun for the kids.

sling.definition: An instrument for throwing stones or other missiles, consisting of a short strap with two strings fastened to its ends, or with a string fastened to one end and a light stick to the other.

slippers.definition: A low soft shoe that can be slipped on and off easily.

sloth.definition: Laziness; slowness in the mindset; disinclination to action or labour.

smell.definition: A sensation, pleasant or unpleasant, detected by inhaling air (or, the case of water-breathing animals, water) carrying airborne molecules of a substance.
smell.example: I love the smell of fresh bread.

smile.definition: A facial expression comprised by flexing the muscles of both ends of one's mouth, often showing the front teeth, without vocalisation, and in humans is a common involuntary or voluntary expression of happiness, pleasure, amusement or anxiety.
smile.example: He always puts a smile on my face.

smoke.definition: The visible vapor/vapour, gases, and fine particles given off by burning or smoldering material.

snail.definition: Any of very many animals (either hermaphroditic or nonhermaphroditic), of the class Gastropoda, having a coiled shell.

snake.definition: A legless reptile of the sub-order Serpentes with a long, thin body and a fork-shaped tongue.

snap.definition: A quick breaking or cracking sound or the action of producing such a sound.

snore.definition: The act of snoring, and the noise produced.

snow.definition: The frozen, crystalline state of water that falls as precipitation.

snowball.definition: A ball of snow, usually one made in the hand and thrown for amusement in a snowball fight; also a larger ball of snow made by rolling a snowball around in snow that sticks to it and increases its diameter.

snowboard.definition: A board, somewhat like a broad ski, or a very long skateboard with no wheels, used in the sport of snowboarding.

snowflake.definition: A crystal of snow, having approximate hexagonal symmetry.

snowman.definition: A humanoid figure made with large snowballs stacked on each other. Human traits like a face and arms may be fashioned with sticks (arms), a carrot (nose), and stones or coal (eyes, mouth).

soap.definition: A substance able to mix with both oil and water, used for cleaning, often in the form of a solid bar or in liquid form, derived from fats or made synthetically.
soap.example: I tried washing my hands with soap, but the stain wouldn't go away.

society.definition: A long-standing group of people sharing cultural aspects such as language, dress, norms of behavior and artistic forms.
society.example: This society has been known for centuries for its colorful clothing and tight-knit family structure.

socks.definition: A knitted or woven covering for the foot.

sofa.definition: A raised area of a building's floor, usually covered with carpeting, used for sitting.

softball.definition: A game similar to baseball but played with a larger and softer ball which can be thrown overhand or underhand.

software.definition: Encoded computer instructions, usually modifiable (unless stored in some form of unalterable memory such as ROM).

soil.definition: A mixture of mineral particles and organic material, used to support plant growth.

son.example: Before the birth of the man's child, he said: "I want a son, not a daughter."

song.definition: A musical composition with lyrics for voice or voices, performed by singing.
song.example: Thomas listened to his favorite song on the radio yesterday.

sonnet.definition: A fixed verse form of Italian origin consisting of fourteen lines that are typically five-foot iambics and rhyme according to one of a few prescribed schemes.

sorcerer.definition: A magician or wizard, sometimes specifically male.

soup.definition: Any of various dishes commonly made by combining liquids, such as water or stock with other ingredients, such as meat and vegetables, that contribute flavor and texture.
soup.example: Pho is a traditional Vietnamese soup.

south.definition: One of the four major compass points, specifically 180°, directed toward the South Pole, and conventionally downwards on a map, abbreviated as S.

spaceship.definition: A vehicle that flies through space.

spaghetti.definition: A type of pasta made in the shape of long thin strings.

spare.definition: The act of sparing; moderation; restraint.

sparrow.definition: The house sparrow, Passer domesticus; a small bird with a short bill, and brown, white and gray feathers.

speech.definition: The faculty of uttering articulate sounds or words; the ability to speak or to use vocalizations to communicate.
speech.example: It was hard to hear the sounds of his speech over the noise. He had a bad speech impediment.

speed.definition: The state of moving quickly or the capacity for rapid motion; rapidity.
speed.example: How does Usain Bolt run at that speed?

spell.definition: Words or a formula supposed to have magical powers.
spell.example: He cast a spell to cure warts.

sphinx.definition: A creature with the head of a person and the body of an animal (commonly a lion).

spider.definition: Any of various eight-legged, predatory arthropods, of the order Araneae, most of which spin webs to catch prey.

spiderweb.definition: The net-like construct of a spider containing sticky strands to catch prey.

spine.definition: The series of bones situated at the back from the head to the pelvis of a person, or from the head to the tail of an animal; backbone, vertebral column.

spirit.definition: The soul of a person or other creature. What moves through experience into self-definition as souls purpose.

spit.definition: A thin metal or wooden rod on which meat is skewered for cooking, often over a fire.

spitball.definition: A pitch of a baseball that has been partly covered with saliva, illegal at most levels.

spite.definition: Ill will or hatred toward another, accompanied with the desire to irritate, annoy, or thwart; a want to disturb or put out another; mild malice
spite.example: He was so filled with spite for his ex-wife, he could not hold down a job.

sponge.definition: Any of various marine invertebrates, mostly of the phylum Porifera, that have a porous skeleton often of silica.

spool.definition: A reel; a device around which thread, wire or cable is wound, especially a cylinder or spindle.

spoon.definition: An implement for eating or serving; a scooped utensil whose long handle is straight, in contrast to a ladle.

sport.definition: Any activity that uses physical exertion or skills competitively under a set of rules that is not based on aesthetics.

spot.definition: A round or irregular patch on the surface of a thing having a different color, texture etc. and generally round in shape.
spot.example: The leopard is noted for the spots of color in its fur.

spotlight.definition: A bright, directional light or lamp, especially one used to illuminate the focus or center of attention on a stage.

spray.definition: A fine, gentle, dispersed mist of liquid.
spray.example: The sailor could feel the spray from the waves.

spring.definition: To weaken, as a joint, ligament, or muscle, by sudden and excessive exertion, as by wrenching; to overstrain, or stretch injuriously, but without luxation

square.definition: A polygon with four sides of equal length and four right angles; an equilateral rectangle; a regular quadrilateral.

squash.definition: A sport played in a walled court with a soft rubber ball and bats like tennis racquets.

squirrel.definition: Any of the rodents of the family Sciuridae distinguished by their large bushy tail.

stable.definition: A building, wing or dependency set apart and adapted for lodging and feeding (and training) animals with hoofs, especially horses.
stable.example: There were stalls for fourteen horses in the squire's stables.

stadium.definition: A venue where sporting events are held.

staff.definition: (plural staffs or staves) A long, straight, thick wooden rod or stick, especially one used to assist in walking.

stage.example: Completion of an identifiable stage of maintenance such as removing an aircraft engine for repair or storage.

stairs.definition: A single step in a staircase.

stamp.definition: An act of stamping the foot, paw or hoof.
stamp.example: The horse gave two quick stamps and rose up on its hind legs.

staple.definition: A town containing merchants who have exclusive right, under royal authority, to purchase or produce certain goods for export; also, the body of such merchants seen as a group.

star.definition: Any small luminous dot appearing in the cloudless portion of the night sky, especially with a fixed location relative to other such dots.

starfish.definition: Any of various asteroids or other echinoderms (not in fact fish) with usually five arms, many of which eat bivalves or corals by everting their stomach.

start.example: The movie was entertaining from start to finish.

state.definition: A condition; a set of circumstances applying at any given time.

steak.definition: Beefsteak, a slice of beef, broiled or cut for broiling.

steam.definition: The vapor formed when water changes from liquid phase to gas phase.

steel.definition: An artificial metal produced from iron, harder and more elastic than elemental iron; used figuratively as a symbol of hardness.

step.definition: An advance or movement made from one foot to the other; a pace.

stethoscope.definition: A medical instrument used for listening to sounds produced within the body, often combined with a sphygmomanometer

stew.definition: A cooking-dish used for boiling; a cauldron.

stick.definition: An elongated piece of wood or similar material, typically put to some use, for example as a wand or baton.

stingray.definition: Any of various large, venomous rays, of the orders Rajiformes and Myliobatiformes, having a barbed, whiplike tail.

stocking.definition: A soft garment, usually knit or woven, worn on the foot and lower leg under shoes or other footwear.

stomach.definition: An organ in animals that stores food in the process of digestion.

store.definition: A place where items may be accumulated or routinely kept.
store.example: This building used to be a store for old tires.

stork.definition: A large wading bird with long legs and a long beak of the family Ciconiidae.

storm.definition: Any disturbed state of the atmosphere, especially as affecting the earth's surface, and strongly implying destructive or unpleasant weather.

story.definition: A sequence of real or fictional events; or, an account of such a sequence.
story.example: The book tells the story of two roommates.

stove.definition: A heater, a closed apparatus to burn fuel for the warming of a room.

stowaway.definition: A person who hides on board a ship, train, etc. so as to get a free passage.

stranger.definition: Not normal; odd, unusual, surprising, out of the ordinary.
stranger.example: He thought it strange that his girlfriend wore shorts in the winter.

strategy.definition: The science and art of military command as applied to the overall planning and conduct of warfare.

strawberry.definition: The sweet, usually red, edible fruit of certain plants of the genus Fragaria.
strawberry.example: They went to pick strawberries today.

street.definition: A paved part of road, usually in a village or a town.
street.example: Walk down the street until you see a hotel on the right.

strength.definition: The quality or degree of being strong.
strength.example: It requires great strength to lift heavy objects.

string.definition: A building, wing or dependency set apart and adapted for lodging and feeding (and training) animals with hoofs, especially horses.
string.example: There were stalls for fourteen horses in the squire's stables.

stroke.definition: An act of stroking (moving one's hand over a surface).
stroke.example: She gave the cat a stroke.

student.definition: A person who studies or learns about a particular subject.
student.example: He is a student of life.

studio.definition: An artist’s or photographer’s workshop or the room in which an artist works.
studio.example: His studio was cramped when he began as an artist.

stuffing.definition: To fill by packing or crowding something into; to cram with something; to load to excess.
stuffing.example: I'm going to stuff this pillow with feathers.

subject.definition: Likely to be affected by or to experience something.

submarine.definition: A boat that can go underwater.

subway.definition: An underground railway, especially for mass transit of people in urban areas.

success.definition: The achievement of one's aim or goal.
success.example: His third attempt to pass the entrance exam was a success.

sugar.definition: Sucrose in the form of small crystals, obtained from sugar cane or sugar beet and used to sweeten food and drink.

suit.definition: A set of clothes to be worn together, now especially a man's matching jacket and trousers (also business suit or lounge suit), or a similar outfit for a woman.
suit.example: Nick hired a navy-blue suit for the wedding.

suitcase.definition: A large (usually rectangular) piece of luggage used for carrying clothes, and sometimes suits, when travelling.

summer.definition: One of four seasons, traditionally the second, marked by the longest and typically hottest days of the year due to the inclination of the Earth and thermal lag. Typically regarded as being from June 21 to September 22 or 23 in parts of the USA, the months of June, July and August in the United Kingdom and the months of December, January and February in the Southern Hemisphere.

sun.definition: A star, especially when seen as the centre of any single solar system.

sunbathe.example: Do you think it's warm enough outside for a sunbathe?

sunburn.definition: A burn on the skin caused by excess exposure to the sun's rays.

sunflower.definition: Any plant of the genus Helianthus, so called probably from the form and color of its floral head, having the form of a large disk surrounded by yellow ray flowers.

sunglasses.definition: Tinted glasses worn to protect the eyes from the sun.

sunscreen.definition: A cream, to be spread on the skin, containing organic compounds that absorb, and/or titanium dioxide that reflects the sun’s ultraviolet radiation.

supermarket.definition: A large self-service store that sells groceries and, usually, medications, household goods and/or clothing.
supermarket.example: I went to the supermarket to buy some food.

surgeon.definition: One who performs surgery; a doctor who performs operations on people or animals.
surgeon.example: The surgeon refused to operate because the patient was her son.

surprise.example: It was a surprise to find out I owed twice as much as I thought I did.

surround.definition: Anything, such as a fence or border, that surrounds something.

sushi.definition: A Japanese dish made of small portions of sticky white rice flavored with vinegar, usually wrapped in seaweed and filled or topped with fish, vegetables or meat.
sushi.example: For the vegetarians, she served cucumber sushi.

swamp.definition: A piece of wet, spongy land; low ground saturated with water; soft, wet ground which may have a growth of certain kinds of trees, but is unfit for agricultural or pastoral purposes.

swan.definition: Any of various species of large, long-necked waterfowl, of genus Cygnus (bird family: Anatidae), most of which have white plumage.

swarm.definition: A large number of insects, especially when in motion or (for bees) migrating to a new colony.

sweat.definition: Fluid that exits the body through pores in the skin usually due to physical stress and/or high temperature for the purpose of regulating body temperature and removing certain compounds from the circulation.

sweater.definition: A knitted jacket or jersey, usually of thick wool, worn by athletes before or after exercise.

sweep.example: Give the front steps a quick sweep to get rid of those fallen leaves.

sweetheart.definition: A person who is always very kind.
sweetheart.example: She is such a sweetheart: she never complains about me being late.

swim.definition: An act or instance of swimming.

swing.definition: The manner in which something is swung.
swing.example: Door swing indicates direction the door opens.

switch.definition: A bundle of thin sticks, typically made of wood, sometimes bond in such a way that binding can be moved so that it varies the tightness of the binding.

sword.definition: A long-bladed weapon with a hilt, and usually a pommel and cross-guard, which is designed to stab, slash, and/or hack.

swordfish.definition: A large marine fish with a long, pointed bill, Xiphias gladius.

sympathy.definition: A feeling of pity or sorrow for the suffering or distress of another; compassion.

t-shirt.definition: A lightweight shirt without buttons, usually with short sleeves and no collar. Often made of cotton and frequently bears a picture or slogan.
t-shirt.example: Many bands make more money from T-shirt sales than from sale of tickets.

table.definition: Furniture with a top surface to accommodate a variety of uses.

tablespoon.definition: A large spoon, used for eating food from a bowl.

tablet.definition: A slab of clay used for inscription.

tackle.definition: A device for grasping an object and an attached means of moving it, as a rope and hook.

taco.definition: A Mexican snack food; a small tortilla (soft or hard shelled), with typically some type of meat, rice, beans, cheese, diced vegetables (usually tomatoes and lettuce, as served in the United States, and cilantro, onion, and avocado, as served in México) and salsa.

tadpole.definition: A young toad or frog in its larval stage of development that lives in water, has a tail and no legs, and, like a fish, breathes through gills.

tail.definition: The caudal appendage of an animal that is attached to its posterior and near the anus.
tail.example: Most primates have a tail and fangs.

tale.definition: An account of an asserted fact or circumstance; a rumour; a report, especially an idle or malicious story; a piece of gossip or slander; a lie.

tango.definition: A Standard ballroom dance in 4/4 time; or a social dance, the Argentine tango.

tank.definition: A closed container for liquids or gases.

target.definition: A butt or mark to shoot at, as for practice, or to test the accuracy of a firearm, or the force of a projectile.
target.example: Take careful aim at the target.

taste.definition: One of the sensations produced by the tongue in response to certain chemicals; the quality of giving this sensation.
taste.example: He had a strange taste in his mouth.

tattoo.definition: An image made in the skin with ink and a needle.

tax.definition: Money paid to the government other than for transaction-specific goods and services.

taxi.definition: A vehicle that may be hired for single journeys by members of the public, driven by a taxi driver.

tea.definition: A drug smoked or ingested for euphoric effect, cannabis.
tea.example: After smoking a bowl of that fine marijuana, they ate some brownies.

teacher.definition: A person who teaches, especially one employed in a school.

teacup.definition: A small cup, usually with a handle, used for drinking tea; normally sits in a saucer as part of a tea set.

team.definition: A set of draught animals, such as two horses in front of a carriage.

teapot.definition: A vessel for brewing and serving tea.

tear.definition: A hole or break caused by tearing.
tear.example: A small tear is easy to mend, if it is on the seam.

tearful.definition: Accompanied by tears; crying, or about to cry.
tearful.example: Aaron was a little tearful until Laura came to reassure him.

teenager.definition: A person between 13 and 19 years of age; an adolescent.

teepee.definition: To toilet paper; to throw toilet paper in rolls over a structure, so the structure becomes draped with it.

telephone.definition: A telecommunication device (originally mechanical, and now electronic) used for two-way talking with another person (now often shortened to phone).

telescope.definition: A monocular optical instrument that magnifies distant objects, especially in astronomy.

television.definition: An electronic communication medium that allows the transmission of real-time visual images, and often sound.
television.example: It’s a good thing that television doesn’t transmit smell.

temperature.definition: A measure of cold or heat, often measurable with a thermometer.
temperature.example: The temperature in the room dropped nearly 20 degrees; it went from hot to cold.

tempt.definition: To provoke someone to do wrong, especially by promising a reward; to entice.
tempt.example: She tempted me to eat the apple.

ten.definition: A set or group with ten elements.
ten.example: We divided the chocolates into tens to hand out to Hallowe'en visitors.

tennis.definition: A sport played by two players (or four in doubles), who alternately strike the ball over a net using racquets.

tension.definition: The condition of being held in a state between two or more forces, which are acting in opposition to each other.

tent.definition: A pavilion or portable lodge consisting of skins, canvas, or some strong cloth, stretched and sustained by poles, used for sheltering people from the weather.
tent.example: We were camping in a three-man tent.

text.definition: A writing consisting of multiple glyphs, characters, symbols or sentences.

thanks.definition: An expression of appreciation; a thought.

theater.definition: A place or building, consisting of a stage and seating, in which an audience gathers to watch plays, musical performances, public ceremonies, and so on.

thermometer.definition: An apparatus used to measure temperature.

thief.definition: One who carries out a theft.

thirteen.definition: The cardinal number occurring after twelve and before fourteen, represented in Roman numerals as XIII and in Arabic numerals as 13.
thirteen.example: There are thirteen cards of each of the four suits in a deck of playing cards.

thought.definition: To ponder, to go over in one's head.
thought.example: Idly, the detective thought what his next move should be.

thread.definition: A long, thin and flexible form of material, generally with a round cross-section, used in sewing, weaving or in the construction of string.

throat.definition: The front part of the neck.
throat.example: The wild pitch bounced and hit the catcher in the throat.

throne.definition: An impressive seat used by a monarch, often on a raised dais in a throne room and reserved for formal occasions.

thumb.definition: The short thick digit of the hand that for humans has the most mobility and can be made to oppose (moved to touch) all of the other fingers.

thunder.definition: The loud rumbling, cracking, or crashing sound caused by expansion of rapidly heated air around a lightning bolt.

thunderbolt.definition: A flash of lightning accompanied by a crash of thunder.

ticket.definition: A pass entitling the holder to admission to a show, concert, etc.

tiger.definition: Panthera tigris, a large predatory mammal of the cat family, indigenous to Asia.

till.definition: Until; to, up to; as late as (a given time).
till.example: I have to work till eight o'clock tonight.

time.definition: The inevitable progression into the future with the passing of present and past events.
time.example: Time stops for nobody.   the ebb and flow of time

tin.definition: A malleable, ductile, metallic element, resistant to corrosion, with atomic number 50 and symbol Sn.

tinder.definition: Small dry sticks and finely-divided fibrous matter etc., used to help light a fire.

tip.definition: The tip of the external ear.

tiptoe.definition: (usually in the plural) The tip of the toe.

title.definition: A prefix (honorific) or suffix (post-nominal) added to a person's name to signify either veneration, official position or a professional or academic qualification. See also

toast.example: I ate a piece of toast for breakfast.

toaster.definition: One who toasts (cooks lightly by browning).

toddler.definition: A young child who has started walking but not fully mastered it, typically between one and three years old.

toes.definition: Each of the five digits on the end of the foot.

toilet.definition: A covering of linen, silk, or tapestry, spread over a dressing table in a chamber or dressing room.

toll.definition: Loss or damage incurred through a disaster.
toll.example: The war has taken its toll on the people.

tomato.definition: A widely cultivated plant, Solanum lycopersicum, having edible fruit.

tomb.definition: A small building (or "vault") for the remains of the dead, with walls, a roof, and (if it is to be used for more than one corpse) a door. It may be partly or wholly in the ground (except for its entrance) in a cemetery, or it may be inside a church proper or in its crypt. Single tombs may be permanently sealed; those for families (or other groups) have doors for access whenever needed.

tongue.definition: The flexible muscular organ in the mouth that is used to move food around, for tasting and that is moved into various positions to modify the flow of air from the lungs in order to produce different sounds in speech.

tool.definition: A mechanical device intended to make a task easier.
tool.example: Hand me that tool, would you?   I don't have the right tools to start fiddling around with the engine.

tooth.definition: A hard, calcareous structure present in the mouth of many vertebrate animals, generally used for eating.

toothbrush.definition: A brush, used with toothpaste, for cleaning the teeth.

toothpaste.definition: A paste, normally used with a toothbrush, for cleaning the teeth.

toothpick.definition: A small, usually wooden, stick, often pointed at both ends, for removing food residue from between the teeth.

top.definition: The highest or uppermost part of something.
top.example: His kite got caught at the top of the tree.

topic.definition: Subject; theme; a category or general area of interest.
topic.example: A society where a topic cannot be discussed, does not have free speech.

torch.definition: A stick with a flame on one end, used chiefly as a light source; a similarly shaped implement with a replaceable supply of flammable material.
torch.example: The mob of angry villagers carried torches and pitchforks to the vampire's castle.

tornado.definition: A violent windstorm characterized by a mobile, twisting, funnel-shaped cloud.
tornado.example: A tornado is a rotating column of air.

torrent.definition: A violent flow, as of water, lava, etc.; a stream suddenly raised and running rapidly, as down a precipice.
torrent.example: A torrent of green and white water broke over the hull of the sail-boat.

tourist.definition: Someone who travels for pleasure rather than for business.

tournament.definition: During the Middle Ages, a series of battles and other contests designed to prepare knights for war.

towel.definition: A cloth used for wiping, especially one used for drying anything wet, as a person after a bath.

tower.definition: A very tall iron-framed structure, usually painted red and white, on which microwave, radio, satellite, or other communication antennas are installed; mast.

town.definition: A settlement; an area with residential districts, shops and amenities, and its own local government; especially one larger than a village and smaller than a city.
town.example: This town is really dangerous because these youngsters have Beretta handguns.

toy.definition: Something to play with, especially as intended for use by a child.
toy.example: A grown man does not play with a child’s toy.

track.definition: A mark left by something that has passed along.
track.example: Can you see any tracks in the snow?

tractor.definition: A vehicle used in farms e.g. for pulling farm equipment and preparing the fields.

trade.definition: Buying and selling of goods and services on a market.

tradition.definition: A part of culture that is passed from person to person or generation to generation, possibly differing in detail from family to family, such as the way to celebrate holidays.

traffic.definition: Pedestrians or vehicles on roads, or the flux or passage thereof.
traffic.example: The traffic is slow during rush hour.

trail.definition: The track or indication marking the route followed by something that has passed, such as the footprints of animal on land or the contrail of an airplane in the sky.

trainer.definition: A person who trains another; a coach.

trap.definition: A machine or other device designed to catch (and sometimes kill) animals, either by holding them in a container, or by catching hold of part of the body.
trap.example: I put down some traps in my apartment to try and deal with the mouse problem.

trash.definition: Useless things to be discarded; rubbish; refuse.

treasure.definition: A collection of valuable things; accumulated wealth; a stock of money, jewels, etc.

treat.definition: An entertainment, outing, food, drink, or other indulgence provided by someone for the enjoyment of others.
treat.example: Here are some healthy Halloween treats for ghouls and witches of all ages.

tree.definition: Fast growing function based on Kruskal's tree theorem.

trenchcoat.definition: A military-style raincoat with a belt and deep pockets and often epaulettes.

triangle.definition: A polygon with three sides and three angles.

tribe.definition: A socially, ethnically, or politically cohesive group of people.

trick.definition: Something designed to fool or swindle.
trick.example: It was just a trick to say that the house was underpriced.

tricycle.definition: A cycle with three wheels, powered by pedals and usually intended for young children.

trip.definition: A journey; an excursion or jaunt
trip.example: We made a trip to the beach.

troll.definition: A supernatural being of varying size, now especially a grotesque humanoid creature living in caves or hills or under bridges.

trombone.definition: A musical instrument in the brass family, having a cylindrical bore, and usually a sliding tube (but sometimes piston valves, and rarely both). Most often refers to the tenor trombone, which is the most common type of trombone and has a fundamental tone of B♭ˌ (contra B♭).
trombone.example: Jim plays the trombone very well.

trouble.example: He was in trouble when the rain started.

truck.definition: A small wheel or roller, specifically the wheel of a gun carriage.

trumpet.definition: A musical instrument of the brass family, generally tuned to the key of B-flat; by extension, any type of lip-vibrated aerophone, most often valveless and not chromatic.
trumpet.example: The royal herald sounded a trumpet to announce their arrival.

trust.definition: Confidence in or reliance on some person or quality.
trust.example: He needs to regain her trust if he is ever going to win her back.

truth.definition: True facts, genuine depiction or statements of reality.
truth.example: The truth is that our leaders knew a lot more than they were letting on.

tsunami.definition: A very large and destructive wave, generally caused by a tremendous disturbance in the ocean, such as an undersea earthquake or volcanic eruption. Tsunami are usually a series of waves, or wave train.

tuba.definition: A large brass musical instrument, usually in the bass range, played through a vibration of the lips upon the mouthpiece and fingering of the keys.

tulip.definition: A type of flowering plant, genus Tulipa.

tumble.definition: A fall, especially end over end.
tumble.example: I took a tumble down the stairs and broke my tooth.

turtle.definition: Any land or marine reptile of the order Testudines, characterised by a protective shell enclosing its body. See also tortoise.

tusk.definition: One of a pair of elongated pointed teeth that extend outside the mouth of an animal such as walrus, elephant or wild boar.
tusk.example: Until the CITES sales ban, elephant tusks were the 'backbone' of the legal ivory trade.

tutor.definition: One who teaches another (usually called a student, learner, or tutee) in a one-on-one or small-group interaction.
tutor.example: He passed the difficult class with help from his tutor.

tutu.definition: A ballet skirt made of layered stiff but light netting.
tutu.example: The ballet dancer representing the swan wore a white tutu.

tuxedo.definition: A typically black formal jacket worn by men.

twelve.example: Fractions would be a little easier if we counted by twelves.

type.definition: A grouping based on shared characteristics; a class.
type.example: This type of plane can handle rough weather more easily than that type of plane.

umbrella.definition: Cloth-covered frame used for protection against rain or sun.
umbrella.example: Quick, grab that umbrella before you get rained on!

uncle.definition: The brother or brother-in-law of one’s parent.

underground.definition: An underground railway, especially for mass transit of people in urban areas.

underwear.definition: Clothes worn next to the skin, underneath outer clothing.

unicycle.definition: A type of cycle that has only one wheel and is powered by pedals; it is most often used by acrobats.

union.definition: The act of uniting or joining two or more things into one.

unit.definition: A particular, minute unit of mass, defined differently for different substances, but so that varying substances of the same general type have the property that one international unit of the one has the same effect on the human body as one international unit of the other.

university.definition: Institution of higher education (typically accepting students from the age of about 17 or 18, depending on country, but in some exceptional cases able to take younger students) where subjects are studied and researched in depth and degrees are offered.
university.example: The only reason why I haven't gone to university is because I can't afford it.

user.definition: One who uses or makes use of something, a consumer/client or an express or implied licensee (free user) or a trespasser.

vacation.definition: Freedom from some business or activity.

vampire.definition: A mythological undead creature said to feed on the blood of the living.

vanilla.definition: Any tropical, climbing orchid of the genus Vanilla (especially Vanilla planifolia), bearing podlike fruit yielding an extract used in flavoring food or in perfumes.

vase.definition: An upright open container used mainly for displaying fresh, dried, or artificial flowers.

vegetarian.definition: A person who does not eat animal flesh, or, in some cases, use any animal products.

vehicle.definition: A conveyance; a device for carrying or transporting substances, objects or individuals.

vein.definition: A blood vessel that transports blood from the capillaries back to the heart.

version.definition: A specific form or variation of something.

vest.definition: A loose robe or outer garment worn historically by men in Arab or Middle Eastern countries.

village.definition: A rural habitation of size between a hamlet and a town.
village.example: There are 2 churches and 3 shops in our village.

violet.definition: A monocotyledonous plant (Allium cepa), allied to garlic, used as vegetable and spice.

violin.definition: A musical four-string instrument, generally played with a bow or by plucking the string, with the pitch set by pressing the strings at the appropriate place with the fingers; also any instrument of the violin family.

virus.definition: A submicroscopic, non-cellular structure consisting of a core of DNA or RNA surrounded by a protein coat, that requires a living host cell to replicate, and often causes disease in the host organism.

vision.definition: The sense or ability of sight.

vitamin.definition: Any of a specific group of organic compounds essential in small quantities for healthy human growth, metabolism, development, and body function; found in minute amounts in plant and animal foods or sometimes produced synthetically; deficiencies of specific vitamins produce specific disorders.

voice.definition: Sound uttered by the mouth, especially by human beings in speech or song; sound thus uttered considered as possessing some special quality or character
voice.example: His low voice allowed him to become a bass in the choir.

volcano.definition: A vent or fissure on the surface of a planet (usually in a mountainous form) with a magma chamber attached to the mantle of a planet or moon, periodically erupting forth lava and volcanic gases onto the surface.

volleyball.definition: A game played on a rectangular court between two teams of two to six players which involves striking a ball back and forth over a net.

volume.definition: A three-dimensional measure of space that comprises a length, a width and a height. It is measured in units of cubic centimeters in metric, cubic inches or cubic feet in English measurement.
volume.example: The room is 9x12x8, so its volume is 864 cubic feet.

waffle.definition: A flat pastry pressed with a grid pattern.
waffle.example: The brunch was waffles with strawberries and whipped cream.

wag.example: The wag of my dog's tail expresses happiness.

wagon.definition: A four-wheeled cart for hauling loads.

waist.definition: The part of the body between the pelvis and the stomach.

waiter.definition: A male or female attendant who serves customers at their tables in a restaurant, café or similar.
waiter.example: Waiter! There's a fly in my soup.

waitress.definition: A female attendant who serves customers in a restaurant, café, or similar.

wall.definition: A rampart of earth, stones etc. built up for defensive purposes.

wallet.definition: A small case, often flat and often made of leather, for keeping money (especially paper money), credit cards, etc.
wallet.example: The thief stole all the money and credit cards out of the old man's wallet.

walrus.definition: A large Arctic marine mammal related to seals and having long tusks, tough, wrinkled skin, and four flippers, Odobenus rosmarus.

wand.definition: A hand-held narrow rod, usually used for pointing or instructing, or as a traditional emblem of authority.

war.definition: Organized, large-scale, armed conflict between countries or between national, ethnic, or other sizeable groups, usually involving the engagement of military forces.
war.example: The war was largely between Sunni and Shia militants.

warehouse.definition: A place for storing large amounts of products. In logistics, a place where products go to from the manufacturer before going to the retailer.

warning.definition: To make (someone) aware of (something impending); especially:

wasp.definition: Any of many types of stinging flying insect resembling a hornet.
