watch.example: More people today carry a watch on their wrists than in their pockets.

water.definition: A substance (of molecular formula H₂O) found at room temperature and pressure as a clear liquid; it is present naturally as rain, and found in rivers, lakes and seas; its solid form is ice and its gaseous form is steam.
water.example: By the action of electricity, the water was resolved into its two parts, oxygen and hydrogen.

waterfall.definition: A flow of water over the edge of a cliff.

watermelon.definition: A plant of the species Citrullus lanatus, bearing a melon-like fruit.

wave.definition: To move back and forth repeatedly and somewhat loosely.
wave.example: The flag waved in the gentle breeze.

wavelength.definition: The length of a single cycle of a wave, as measured by the distance between one peak or trough of a wave and the next; it is often designated in physics as λ, and corresponds to the velocity of the wave divided by its frequency.

way.definition: (heading) To do with a place or places.

weakness.example: In a small number of horses, muscle weakness may progress to paralysis.

weather.definition: The short term state of the atmosphere at a specific time and place, including the temperature, relative humidity, cloud cover, precipitation, wind, etc.

web.example: Some of that content is now only available on the Web.

wedding.definition: To perform the marriage ceremony for; to join in matrimony.

wedge.definition: One of the simple machines; a piece of material, such as metal or wood, thick at one edge and tapered to a thin edge at the other for insertion in a narrow crevice, used for splitting, tightening, securing, or levering.
wedge.example: Stick a wedge under the door, will you? It keeps blowing shut.

week.definition: Any period of seven consecutive days.

weekend.definition: The break in the working week, usually two days including the traditional holy or sabbath day. Thus in western countries, Saturday and Sunday.

welcome.definition: The act of greeting someone’s arrival, especially by saying "Welcome!"; reception.

welder.definition: One who welds, or unites pieces of iron, etc., by welding.

werewolf.definition: A person who is transformed or can transform into a wolf or a wolflike human, often said to transform during a full moon.

west.definition: One of the four principal compass points, specifically 270°, conventionally directed to the left on maps; the direction of the setting sun at an equinox, abbreviated as W.

whale.definition: Any of several species of large sea mammals of the infraorder Cetacea.

wheel.definition: A circular device capable of rotating on its axis, facilitating movement or transportation or performing labour in machines.

wheelchair.definition: A chair mounted on large wheels for the transportation or use of a sick or disabled person.

while.definition: An uncertain duration of time, a period of time.
while.example: He lectured for quite a long while.

whisk.example: With a quick whisk, she swept the cat from the pantry with her broom.

whisker.definition: That part of the beard which grows upon the sides of the face, usually of the male, or upon the chin, or upon both.

whisper.definition: The act of speaking in a quiet voice, especially, without vibration of the vocal cords.

whistle.definition: A device designed to be placed in the mouth and blown, or driven by steam or some other mechanism, to make a whistling sound.

wife.definition: A married woman, especially in relation to her spouse.

wig.definition: A head of real or synthetic hair worn on the head to disguise baldness, for cultural or religious reasons, for fashion, or by actors to help them better resemble the character they are portraying.

wind.definition: Real or perceived movement of atmospheric air usually caused by convection or differences in air pressure.
wind.example: As they accelerated onto the motorway, the wind tore the plywood off the car's roof-rack.

windmill.definition: A machine which translates linear motion of wind to rotational motion by means of adjustable vanes called sails.

window.definition: The inedible parts of a grain-producing plant.
window.example: To separate out the chaff, early cultures tossed baskets of grain into the air and let the wind blow away the lighter chaff.

wine.definition: An alcoholic beverage made by fermenting the juice of grapes.
wine.example: She ordered some wine for the meal.

wings.definition: An appendage of an animal's (bird, bat, insect) body that enables it to fly; a similar fin at the side of a ray or similar fish

wink.definition: An act of winking (a blinking of only one eye), or a message sent by winking.

winner.definition: One who has won or often wins.

winter.definition: Traditionally the fourth of the four seasons, typically regarded as being from December 23 to March 20 in continental regions of the Northern Hemisphere or the months of June, July and August in the Southern Hemisphere. It is the time when the sun is lowest in the sky, resulting in short days, and the time of year with the lowest atmospheric temperatures for the region.

wish.definition: A desire, hope, or longing for something or for something to happen.

witch.definition: A person who practices witchcraft; a woman or man who practices witchcraft.

wizard.definition: Someone, usually male, who uses (or has skill with) magic, mystic items, and magical and mystical practices.

wolf.definition: The gray wolf, specifically all subspecies of the gray wolf (Canis lupus) that are not dingoes or dogs.
wolf.example: Check out my pet. He's a wolf.

wood.definition: The substance making up the central part of the trunk and branches of a tree. Used as a material for construction, to manufacture various items, etc. or as fuel.
wood.example: There was lots of wood on the beach.

wool.definition: The hair of the sheep, llama and some other ruminants.

word.definition: The smallest unit of language that has a particular meaning and can be expressed by itself; the smallest discrete, meaningful unit of language. (contrast morpheme.)

world.definition: (with "the") Human collective existence; existence in general.
world.example: There will always be lovers, till the world’s end.

worm.definition: A generally tubular invertebrate of the annelid phylum; an earthworm.

worry.example: I'm afflicted by worry throughout the night.

wound.definition: An injury, such as a cut, stab, or tear, to a (usually external) part of the body.

wrap.definition: To enclose (an object) completely in any flexible, thin material such as fabric or paper.

wrench.definition: A movement that twists or pulls violently; a tug.

wrist.definition: The complex joint between forearm bones, carpus, and metacarpals where the hand is attached to the arm; the carpus in a narrow sense.

writer.definition: A person who writes, or produces literary work.
writer.example: Has your girlfriend written you another letter already? She’s quite a writer!

xylophone.definition: Any musical instrument (percussion idiophone) made of wooden slats graduated so as to make the sounds of the scale when struck with a small drumstick-like mallet; the standard Western concert xylophone or one of its derivatives.
xylophone.example: All I know how to play on my xylophone is "Mary Had a Little Lamb". Would you like to hear it?

yard.definition: A small, usually uncultivated area adjoining or (now especially) within the precincts of a house or other building.

yardstick.definition: A measuring rod thirty-six inches (one yard) long.

year.definition: A solar year, the time it takes the Earth to complete one revolution of the Sun (between 365.24 and 365.26 days depending on the point of reference).
year.example: we moved to this town a year ago;  I quit smoking exactly one year ago

yellow.definition: The colour of gold, butter, or a lemon; the colour obtained by mixing green and red light, or by subtracting blue from white light.

yo-yo.definition: A toy consisting of a spheroidal or cylindrical spindle having a circular groove in which string is wound; it is used by holding the string in the fingers and reeling the spindle up and down by movements of the wrist.
yo-yo.example: I bought a yo-yo from the toy store yesterday.

yolk.definition: The yellow, spherical part of an egg that is surrounded by the white albumen, and serves as nutriment for the growing young.

zebra.definition: Any of three species of genus Equus: E. grevyi, E. quagga, or E. zebra, all with black and white stripes and native to Africa.

zero.definition: The numeric symbol that represents the cardinal number zero.
zero.example: In unary and k-adic notation in general, zero is the empty string.

zigzag.definition: A line or path that proceeds by sharp turns in alternating directions

zombie.definition: A snake god or fetish in religions of West Africa and elsewhere.

zookeeper.definition: A person employed at a zoo to attend to the animals.

zoom.definition: To communicate with someone using the Zoom videoconferencing software.
